summary: Paul Merson and Andros Townsend’s feud reignited after Townsend played only seven minutes in Tottenham’s draw against Burnley.  Merson’s initial criticism of Townsend’s England selection was proven wrong when Townsend scored against Italy, leading Merson to admit his mistake.  Despite seemingly resolving their differences, Merson mocked Townsend’s limited game time against Burnley.

Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.  Muto would be loaned to Vitesse Arnhem next season if the transfer is completed.  While a £4 million deal has been suggested, Muto has not yet decided if he will join Chelsea. He graduated from Keio University with an economics degree two weeks prior to the offer.  Muto scored 13 goals in his debut season with FC Tokyo, was named in the J-League's best XI, and has 11 caps for Japan with one goal.

A Finnish study of over 12,000 children published in Pediatrics indicates a correlation between antibiotic use in babies under six months old and increased likelihood of being overweight by age two.  Repeated prescriptions before age two further elevated this risk, especially in boys, who also experienced slightly increased height. While the study doesn't definitively prove causation, researchers suggest antibiotics may kill gut bacteria that consume food, leading to increased calorie absorption and potentially stimulating appetite.  This may contribute to the childhood obesity epidemic, emphasizing the importance of judicious antibiotic use in infants.

A Queen's Guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace, dropping his rifle and bearskin. The incident, recorded by tourist David Meadwell, happened as the guard took his position. Despite the fall, the guard quickly regained his composure and resumed his duties, though visibly embarrassed. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment.

A&E Networks is remaking the 1977 miniseries *Roots*, which garnered over 100 million viewers, for a 2016 audience.  LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version.  The remake will air simultaneously on A&E, Lifetime, and History.  Producers intend to make the miniseries more reflective of Alex Haley's novel, *Roots: The Saga of an American Family*, and will consult scholars to ensure authenticity.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, alleges that he was assaulted by Clarence House staff on his first day of work in 1978.  He claims he was pinned to a chair and groped by male staff members who attempted to remove his trousers. Though he reported the incident, he left the job the same day and was allegedly threatened to keep quiet.  He contacted palace officials again in 2022 after news of an investigation into historical child sex abuse cases.  His complaint was initially rebuffed but eventually passed to Scotland Yard. A retired royal aide was questioned but denied involvement.  The Palace has stated they will cooperate fully with the police investigation.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced their pregnancy in a rap video parody of the "Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" theme song. The video, viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, features the couple rapping about their journey to parenthood.  They initially told family and friends they weren't ready for kids, but after two months of trying to conceive, Melissa discovered she was pregnant.  The video concludes with a sonogram image.  The couple made the video to share the news with distant loved ones and were surprised by its viral success.  Jesse is the great-great-grandson of Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek.  This isn't the first time the sitcom theme has been used for a pregnancy announcement; a Pennsylvania couple did so last year.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction.  The light gray jacket and skirt, originally slate blue-gray, were part of a 150-item collection from James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head.  Tumblin acquired the dress for $20 in the 1960s. Other notable sales included a hat worn by Leigh ($52,500), Clark Gable's suit ($55,000), and a bonnet worn by Leigh and Olivia de Havilland ($30,000).

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the railing.  He fell 10-12 feet, but was rescued by his parents before help arrived. The child suffered minor injuries and is in stable condition. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the parents.

A deactivated speed camera, previously monitoring a 30mph zone in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been mysteriously repositioned to face a private residence.  Inactive since 2013 due to obsolete technology, the camera is slated for removal or other appropriate action by the Birmingham City Council.  A pilot program for a limited number of sites using updated digital technology is currently under development, but this specific camera is not included in the plan.

Usain Bolt will compete in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2nd and 3rd as part of the Jamaican team.  Bolt stated that he is “fit, healthy and ready to run”.  The JAAA General Secretary expressed excitement about Bolt’s participation in the event.

Neymar and teammate Dani Alves attended a Barcelona basketball game against Real Madrid, which Barcelona won 85-80.  Real Madrid remains ahead of Barcelona in their Euro League division by points difference.  Neymar, who captained Brazil to a 1-0 victory over Chile at the Emirates, returns to La Liga with Barcelona on Sunday to play Celta Vigo.  Neymar was accompanied to the basketball game by his sister Rafaella.

Between Friday and Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued at sea. Save the Children fears 400 migrants are missing after their boat capsized, though the Italian Coast Guard has not confirmed this. Over 10,000 migrants arrived in Italy in the first three months of 2015, mostly from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, transiting through Libya. At least 480 migrants have died this year due to bad weather and overcrowded vessels.

Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over other elite clubs, including Liverpool, after leaving Barcelona.  Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is pleased with Sanchez's decision and performance, acknowledging Liverpool's potential use of their interest in Sanchez as leverage during Luis Suarez's transfer to Barcelona.  Wenger praised Sanchez's quick adaptation and impact on the team.  He downplayed rumors of a summer transfer for Raheem Sterling and commended Brendan Rodgers' management of Liverpool despite losing Suarez and dealing with Sturridge's injury.

Four-time Olympic champion Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7.  Wiggins aims to surpass Rohan Dennis's current record of 52.491km. Tickets go on sale April 19, and the event will be broadcast on Sky Sports.  This attempt is part of Wiggins' return to track cycling as he pursues a British record eighth Olympic medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

Serena Williams had to fight to beat Sara Errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in the Fed Cup on Sunday, but the US still lost 3-2 to Italy and were relegated to World Group II. Williams stated that the match was an "eye-opener," showing her she wasn't as prepared for the clay court season as she thought.  Despite winning, Williams said she needs to adjust her play style for clay courts.  The US captain, Mary Joe Fernandez, is optimistic about getting back into the World Group next year.

River Plate would like to re-sign Radamel Falcao.  Falcao played for River Plate for eight years, from 2001 (age 15) to 2009, scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances.  Although River Plate’s vice president says they “dream of Falcao” and “the doors are open,” they admit a deal is complicated.  Falcao is currently on loan to Manchester United from Monaco, but has only scored four goals this season.  It is uncertain whether Manchester United will keep him or if he will return to Monaco.

Ella Henderson, a finalist on the X Factor and pop star, is the new face of Batiste dry shampoo's 2015 "Ready For It" campaign.  This is Henderson's first brand collaboration.  The campaign features Henderson in various hairstyles, including wavy, down, and a half-ponytail, against a blurred city backdrop.  The partnership was formed by the MILES agency and includes a TV ad featuring Henderson's single, "Mirror Man."  Henderson is excited about the partnership, stating that she regularly uses the product.  Mark Hargreaves of Crown Talent & Media Group, Henderson's management, stated the partnership is a natural fit between a talented artist and a well-loved brand.

Aaron Siler, wanted for felony probation and parole violation, was shot and killed by Officer Pablo Torres on March 14 following a vehicle and foot pursuit.  This incident occurred ten days after Torres shot and wounded 66-year-old Terry Knight, who was armed with knives.  While investigations are ongoing for the Siler shooting, the District Attorney deemed the shooting of Knight justified.  A billboard erected by the Kenosha Professional Police Association featuring Torres and his K9 thanking the community for their support has sparked outrage among Siler's family and friends, who are calling for its removal.  The police association claims no offense was intended.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed by militants in clashes near the border with Pakistan in the town of Negur.  A militant group, Jaish al Adal, claimed responsibility.  Jaish al Adal, an anti-Iranian Sunni Muslim group, aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan.  Iranian officials have requested Pakistani authorities apprehend the surviving militants.  Pakistan condemned the attack and is investigating.

Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani recently addressed parliament, stating that the Air Self Defense Force has never encountered extraterrestrial UFOs.  While jets are scrambled to investigate unidentified flying objects that could violate Japanese airspace, these are often birds or other aircraft.  This topic arose after flamboyant wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki questioned the government's handling of extraterrestrial threats and research into alien visitors. Inoki, known for his past wrestling career and various other endeavors, claims to have personally seen a UFO. This isn't the first time Japanese politicians have discussed the implications of alien visitors, with a 2007 discussion focusing on the legal ramifications of defending against an extraterrestrial invasion.

35-year-old Jin Pai was hospitalized after he cut his leg and buttocks on a broken toilet at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport.  He was standing on the toilet rim to avoid touching the seat due to cleanliness concerns when it broke.  He called his friends for help before being taken to a hospital for stitches.  Although he initially confessed to squatting on the toilet, he later claimed he was sitting when it broke.  Authorities believe the incident was accidental.

56-year-old Kevin Rebbie from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested and charged with aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy.  A 15-year-old girl discovered a hidden camera placed by Rebbie under her bathroom sink, which contained videos of her and other juveniles undressing and showering.  Rebbie admitted to filming the victims, including other juveniles, over a three- or four-year period.  He also confessed to molesting the 15-year-old victim from the time she was nine until she was 13 years old.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama, age 37, created a photo series of daughters posing seriously next to their leaping fathers, dressed in suits, possibly referencing the term "salaryman."  The photos, part of a book titled "Daughter and Salary Man," show the fathers expressing a fun, heroic side, despite some pained expressions from older participants.  The photos are gaining online popularity despite little information being available about the project.

Paul Downton's dismissal as England's managing director paves the way for Kevin Pietersen's potential return to the England team.  Pietersen, who was controversially axed by Downton in 2014 after England's disastrous Ashes tour in Australia, has rejoined Surrey in an attempt to force his way back into the Test set-up for this summer's Ashes series on home soil.  Surrey begins their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt fired coach Ze Maria, rehired him, then fired him again after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani dropped the club to 16th place in the standings, six points adrift of safety.  This was Ze Maria's second stint as Ceahlaul's coach this season, having replaced Florin Marin in January. Serbian Vanya Radinovic will replace Ze Maria.

Radamel Falcao’s former Monaco teammate, Nabil Dirar, stated that Falcao was unhappy in France. However, due to Falcao’s struggles at Manchester United, Dirar believes Falcao regrets his loan move there.  Falcao only scored four goals for Manchester United and they are unlikely to pay the £46 million to make the transfer permanent. Dirar believes Falcao would have played more and participated in the Champions League if he had stayed at Monaco.

Christchurch police are seeking public assistance to identify a tall man wearing a cartoon mask and fluorescent orange sweatshirt who robbed a dairy on Union St. around 12:30 pm on Saturday.  The robber stole the till and approximately $1500 in cash. Anyone with information is asked to contact Crimestoppers.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old Texas math teacher, was arrested twice for inappropriate relationships with 15-year-old students.  The first arrest was in March, after admitting to kissing a student and letting him touch her breasts.  A second 15-year-old student then came forward, alleging Granado had sex with him in her car on two nights in January.  Granado was arrested again in April and released on bail.  She is currently on administrative leave.

In Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, a crocodile was filmed swimming in a marina with a dead dog in its mouth.  The dog belonged to a local bike shop owner and was likely curious about the crocodile before it was snatched. The crocodile held the dog for hours, attracting onlookers.  Crocodiles are common in the area, which is built near mangrove habitats and a crocodile sanctuary.  The American Crocodiles in the region can grow up to 6 meters long and are living closer to humans due to urbanization.  The video of the incident has garnered over 500,000 views online, with some viewers expressing horror.

Hull City manager Steve Bruce remains confident his team can avoid relegation despite a 2-0 loss to Southampton, which leaves them two points above the relegation zone.  He believes eight or nine wins may be enough to stay up. Hull City face difficult upcoming matches against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham, and Manchester United.  Bruce cites long-term injuries to key players including Mohamed Diame, James Chester, Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass as contributing factors to their struggles.  Southampton's win, secured by goals from James Ward-Prowse and Graziano Pellè, moved them up to fifth place.  Southampton manager Ronald Koeman plans to address his team regarding Sadio Mané attempting to take a penalty designated for Ward-Prowse.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, had his students change answers on their SATs exams after the testing session had ended and also altered answers himself.  Following an investigation, the Department for Education voided the entire school's SATs results.  Guffick, while admitting to the actions, claimed he asked students to clarify, not change, their answers.  The National College for Teaching and Leadership issued a ban from the classroom for at least two years, citing the impact of Guffick's actions on the school and students.  Guffick has 28 days to appeal the decision.

Manchester United goalkeeper Anders Lindegaard, who married Swedish model Misse Beqiri in 2014, isn't getting much playing time, but he's enjoying life off the field.  Lindegaard and Beqiri have a son and have been together since 2012.  Beqiri regularly posts modeling photos on her Instagram account.  Lindegaard has struggled to make an impact at Manchester United, making only 19 league appearances in five seasons and is now third-choice goalkeeper. He was linked with a move to FC Midtjylland, but the deal fell through.

Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson’s 10-feet-tall, glowing blue letters that once adorned Yankee Stadium (1976-2008) failed to sell at a Sotheby’s auction.  Despite an estimated value of $300,000-$600,000, the only bid of $260,000 came from a Sotheby’s employee.  A Mets bullpen car from the late 60s, estimated at $20,000-$30,000, sold for $112,500.

Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe were caught inhaling nitrous oxide and pictured with shisha pipes. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers spoke to both players about their responsibilities as professional athletes. Neither player will be disciplined, and Rodgers wants to move forward. Rodgers believes setbacks, like last season's title race and Capital One Cup semi-final loss, are part of the journey to success, citing examples of Champions League winners who experienced losses before achieving victory.  He is focused on leading Liverpool to their first FA Cup final of his reign with the return of Steven Gerrard from suspension.

Mesut Ozil returned to London after playing in Germany’s 2-0 win against Georgia in a Euro 2016 qualifier.  He posted a picture with his dog captioned, “Home Sweet Home.”  Although he missed Arsenal’s previous game against Newcastle due to illness, he is expected to start in the upcoming match against Liverpool.  Since returning from injury, Ozil has made four assists and scored three goals. He says he is adjusting to English football and “fits perfectly.”

Josep Maria Bartomeu, president of Barcelona, has stated that the club has no plans to replace Luis Enrique, whose contract extends to 2016.  Bartomeu is pleased with Enrique's performance, particularly after the Champions League game against PSG and the win against Valencia.  Barcelona are contending for three titles this season.  The win against Valencia featured goals by Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson, Liverpool's vice-captain, has agreed to a new long-term contract through 2020 worth approximately £100,000 a week.  Henderson, 24, whose current contract had 14 months remaining, is the third Liverpool player to sign a contract extension this season, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. He is expected to be considered for club captain after Steven Gerrard’s departure.  Contract talks with Raheem Sterling are expected to resume at the end of the season.

Filipe Luis intends to remain at Chelsea for the duration of his three-year contract, despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him.  While Luis has found it challenging to secure the left back position, he is happy at Chelsea.  His focus is now on the Premier League, where Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is urging the team to maintain focus and win every game. Luis acknowledges the difficulty of the remaining nine games.

Nathan Hughes's three-match ban for accidentally knocking out George North has been overturned on appeal.  Hughes's knee hit North's head as he scored a try, resulting in North being stretchered off the field, unconscious. This was North's third concussion in two months, requiring him to take a month off from playing. While some condemned Hughes, many, including Wasps captain James Haskell and other players, defended him, citing a lack of intent.  The appeal panel agreed, concluding the incident was accidental and rescinding Hughes's red card and ban. He is now free to play but is not expected back until Wasps play Exeter on April 26.

Seattle resident Tim Durkan captured photos of vibrant sunsets over Washington.  These striking sunsets resulted from wildfires in southeastern Siberia, started by farmers burning grass that spread rapidly due to strong winds. The smoke traveled across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, causing the red sunsets.  The smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors like blue and green, allowing reds and oranges to dominate.  As the smoke clears, the sunsets will return to normal.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen and later returned with red spray-painted rims, red detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel.  Schoenig reacted positively, thanking the thieves on Facebook for "pimping out" her car.  She is now having the car professionally cleaned due to the smell of cigarettes and marijuana and has created a smoothie named after the man who helped locate her car.

Manchester City players have incentive-based contracts, tied to Champions League qualification, to comply with Financial Fair Play rules.  If they fail to qualify, players like Aguero, Silva, Hart, and Toure will lose £500,000 each in bonuses, totaling £12 million in squad bonuses.  City's recent loss to Manchester United puts them four points ahead of Liverpool, jeopardizing their Champions League qualification hopes.  Manager Pellegrini admits the team's performance has declined in recent months.  This could also impact their ability to attract top talent like Paul Pogba, who is also a target for Manchester United.

Manchester United’s Under 18 team defeated Manchester City’s Under 18 team 1-0. Callum Gribbin scored the winning goal, a free kick, for Manchester United.  The game was played at Altrincham’s stadium in front of 1,000 fans. Many of the players were from Manchester.  Manchester United’s coach, Paul McGuinness, wanted to give his young players experience in a setting similar to what they might encounter playing for the senior team.  Both teams showed promising talent.

Joe Hart, earning his 50th cap, called Gianluigi Buffon, who earned his 147th cap, a "legend of the game."  Hart, at 27, admires the 37-year-old Buffon and says he is still learning from veterans like him.  He wants to continue playing well for club and country to increase his cap total.

Chipotle has partnered with Postmates to deliver online and mobile orders in 67 cities with a 9% service charge plus Postmates’ fees.  Postmates uses independent contractors similar to Uber.  Starbucks also uses Postmates for delivery.  Taco Bell, McDonald’s, and Burger King are also developing delivery services.  Presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton have both been spotted at Chipotle.

Parents of Boston Marathon bombing’s youngest victim, Martin Richard, are requesting the death penalty be removed from the case against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.  While acknowledging the brutality of the crimes and the pain their family has endured, they support life imprisonment without parole and the waiving of all appeal rights in exchange for taking the death penalty off the table. They believe this will allow their family and the city of Boston to heal and move forward. They also want to avoid reliving the trauma through years of appeals.

A mystery billionaire spent £400 million to convert a Boeing 747 into a luxury home.  The plane, customized over three years, includes bedrooms, multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, and an "aeroloft" with eight beds on the upper deck.  It can accommodate dozens of guests.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with the Dragon spacecraft to resupply the International Space Station. The rocket successfully launched, but landing the rocket stage on a drone ship failed. SpaceX founder Elon Musk tweeted that the rocket landed too hard and tipped over.  The Dragon will deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies to the ISS, including an espresso maker. After five weeks, the Dragon will return to Earth with 3,000 pounds of cargo. This is SpaceX's sixth resupply mission to the ISS.  Landing the rocket stage is part of SpaceX's plan to reduce the cost of space travel by reusing rockets.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding held at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel in Las Vegas on April 23, 2015.  The wedding is part of a contest by NBC's *Today* show, and the winning couple will also receive a reception, a two-night hotel stay, airfare, and tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show.  The chapel is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit outside of Elvis's Memphis home. Couples entered the contest by submitting photos and videos explaining why they deserved to win.

Liverpool defeated Newcastle 2-0, with goals from Sterling and Allen.  Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool can make up the four points separating them and Manchester City in the race for the Champions League.  Both Henderson and Mignolet played their 47th game of the season, equalling the record for appearances by any player in the top five European leagues.

Roma defeated Napoli 1-0 at home, ending a four-month home winless streak in Serie A. Pjanic scored the sole goal in the 25th minute off a counter-attack.  Roma goalkeeper De Sanctis preserved the victory with numerous saves in the second half.  This win puts second-place Roma four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli’s winless streak extends to five games.  Heightened security measures were in place due to past fan violence, but no incidents were reported. Roma played without Totti and Gervinho.  Napoli may have been denied a penalty when Manolas contacted De Guzman. De Sanctis made key saves against Mertens and Gabbiadini to secure the win for Roma.

Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played to a 0-0 draw. Doncaster’s media team’s match highlight video on YouTube was 27 seconds long, 14 seconds of which was match action, including the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle.

Roland Giroux has a unique relationship with his blood parrot cichlid.  He interacts with his fish by stroking and massaging it in its tank. The fish enjoys this interaction, returning for more even after swimming away.  Giroux developed this bond after removing two other fish from the tank for bullying the cichlid. He began hand-feeding it and noticed it becoming more sociable, eventually enjoying being stroked and becoming frustrated if Giroux doesn't interact with it daily.  He now plays with the fish for at least 15 minutes each day.

Ben Stokes is a fiery character in the English cricket team, known for both his on-field aggression and occasional outbursts.  While his behavior sometimes needs to be managed, England values Stokes's exuberance and wants to foster his natural talent.  They believe he can be a key player, contributing both runs and wickets, as long as his aggression is channeled appropriately.  The team plans to play Stokes as much as possible to help him reach his full potential.

Wales’ Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium at Cardiff City Stadium on June 12th has sold out its 33,000 seats.  Both teams are tied atop Group B with 11 points each, though Belgium is ranked higher due to goal difference.  Despite the Millennium Stadium’s larger capacity, the match will be played at Cardiff City Stadium due to UEFA rules about venue changes and the Welsh team’s preference for the smaller stadium.

Defending champion England U17 will face Italy, Holland, and the Republic of Ireland in Group D of the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. The team, coached by John Peacock, includes players from various Premier League clubs, such as Chelsea's Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo, Arsenal's Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi, and Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold. England's matches are scheduled for May 7 (Italy), May 10 (Holland), and May 13 (Ireland).

Manchester City are looking to sign Evangelos Patoulidis, a 14-year-old Anderlecht playmaker who has also garnered interest from Arsenal and Barcelona.  Patoulidis previously rejected Barcelona at age 12 to continue his studies. City have spoken with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock hoping to agree on a compensation package.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found strangled and beaten to death in a Fulham flat at the end of March.  A 23-year-old man was arrested but released on bail.  Police are seeking information from anyone who had contact with Santillan in the hours before her death.

Dawn, who had seven miscarriages, accused her housemate Jamie of stealing £207 she had saved for a gravestone for one of her babies.  A lie detector test on The Jeremy Kyle Show proved Jamie had taken the money. Jamie had also sent a Facebook message to Dawn confessing to the theft, but blaming his girlfriend.  Dawn was devastated by the betrayal.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis (mostly women, children, elderly, and ill) in northern Iraq.  Arab tribal leaders coordinated the release with Peshmerga forces, who then transported the freed Yazidis to Irbil.  This is not the first instance of ISIS releasing Yazidis since their attacks last summer, which displaced hundreds of thousands and led to a humanitarian crisis.  Last year, ISIS slaughtered hundreds of Yazidis and enslaved and raped female captives.  An international coalition responded with aid, rescues, and airstrikes.

Harry Kane, nominated for PFA Player and Young Player of the Season, is featured in a new animated video by Copa90. The video highlights some of Kane’s best goals and celebrations of the season, including goals against Chelsea, Arsenal, and his England debut goal.  The video’s title, “Harry Kane – PFA Player of the Year?” references the upcoming awards ceremony where he is a contender for the top prize against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez.

Despite Liverpool's trophyless season and likely absence from the top four, Jamie Carragher supports Brendan Rodgers as the team's leader.  Carragher believes the new players haven't fully integrated yet and that Rodgers' job is to identify areas for improvement and make the right signings to get back into the top four and win trophies next season.  Carragher also received a Beacon Award for his community work with the 23 Foundation, providing coaching in underprivileged areas of Merseyside.

Four-year-old James Hayward's toy Nerf gun was confiscated at East Midlands Airport because it was considered a security risk.  His father, Phil Hayward, called the security check 'ludicrous' and 'over-zealous'.  Although offered to have the toy mailed to their home, the family opted to purchase a new one upon returning from their holiday.  The airport maintains their actions were in accordance with government regulations prohibiting items resembling prohibited items, such as replica guns.

A man from Humpty Doo in the Northern Territory, Australia, advertised for a girlfriend/wife on Gumtree.  He described himself as a 31-year-old, white, tattooed, athletic male, 175cm tall, financially successful, and owning property.  His requirements include a non-smoker and non-drinker who is fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, a good cook, and great in bed.  He offers perks such as gym membership, phone, laptop, and potentially a company car. He states all reasonable offers will be considered, but former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke's proposal to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 and change the definition of "home-grown" to mean training in England for three years before age 18 (instead of 21) has the support of five former England managers.  They argue that failure to implement these changes will hurt English football and widen the gap between England and top international teams.  They cite the shrinking pool of English talent at the top level as a key reason for England's failure to win major tournaments since 1966, despite the emergence of promising young players like Barkley, Sterling, and Kane.

In the upcoming Poldark episode, Demelza gives birth to a daughter shortly after announcing her pregnancy in the previous episode.  Ross Poldark professes his love for Demelza. Fans noted the rapid progression of Demelza's pregnancy, comparing it to Elizabeth's similarly fast pregnancy in the show. One fan tweeted, "If you are pregnant in Poldark times expect to have it in the next 10 minutes."

Leicester City, currently bottom of the Barclays Premier League, are three points from safety after consecutive wins. Manager Nigel Pearson has urged his team to concentrate on their own performance and not be distracted by their relegation rivals. He stressed the importance of focusing on their remaining games to maintain their chance of survival. While acknowledging the positive impact of other teams' results, Pearson cautioned against excessive optimism and emphasized the need for continued focus.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara swam almost 14,000 miles from Russia to Mexico, setting a new record for the longest mammal migration.  This journey, surpassing the previous record of 10,190 miles held by a humpback whale, suggests Varvara may be an eastern gray whale, not a western gray whale as previously thought.  This raises questions about the genetic differences between the two and could mean the endangered western gray whale population is even smaller than believed.

Off the east coast of Hokkaido Island, Japan, 1,000-1,640 feet of seabed rose 30-50 feet above sea level, creating a new 100-foot wide stretch of coastline.  Geologists believe melting snow and ice caused a nearby landslide, forcing the seabed upwards.  Local residents reported no tremors or sounds, and authorities do not expect further expansion.

Gregory van der Wiel denies rumors of leaving Paris Saint-Germain, stating his love for the club, city, and teammates.  Despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc over being dropped from a Champions League match, Van der Wiel insists he is happy and wants to sign a new contract.  However, PSG's continued interest in Dani Alves may impact Van der Wiel's future with the club.

Carlos Tevez, whose contract with Juventus expires at the end of next season, has told the club he wants to leave this summer to return to Boca Juniors.  Boca Juniors confirmed they are close to a deal, but Tevez must first terminate his Juventus contract. Juventus, while reluctant to lose their top scorer (17 goals), has accepted Tevez’s decision and begun seeking replacements.  Tevez’s international manager has stated that a move to Boca Juniors would not be a step down for the player.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped his trousers during his team's 6-1 Champions League quarter-final win over Porto.  The incident exposed his underwear, about which Guardiola joked he'd need new ones for the next match.  Bayern's win, including goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso and two from Robert Lewandowski, secured their place in the Champions League semi-finals.

A three-car collision on the Brisbane Valley Highway near Fernvale injured ten people, including four children. Two adults and two children with moderate injuries were airlifted to Princess Alexandra Hospital. Six others, including three children, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries. One person was trapped and freed using hydraulic cutting gear. The highway was closed for several hours with diversions in place.

Arsenal’s Mesut Ozil showed off his new Apple Watch on Instagram, comparing it to Michael Knight’s watch from Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to start against Chelsea on Sunday.  Meanwhile, Ray Parlour believes Jack Wilshere is the future of Arsenal, but his fitness record remains a concern.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby on Sunday.  He has sent off two Manchester United players and one Manchester City player this season.  Vincent Kompany's red card was during an international match between Belgium and Israel.  The Manchester derby could determine which team finishes second in the Premier League.

Bob Katter accused the Queensland government of treating Billy Gordon like a "little black puppet on a string," assuming he would resign after domestic violence accusations and admitting to a criminal past. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, cited his own experience with racism and defended his statement, explaining the term "black puppet" stemmed from his background and belief that the government's actions had racial overtones.  He questioned why Gordon was expected to resign when other federal MPs in similar situations weren't.  While some criticized Katter's terminology, he maintained that Gordon should not become a puppet for the government like other independent MPs have.

19-year-old Dayna Dobias, who has cerebral palsy, creates dance videos to challenge stereotypes about disabilities.  She aims to inspire others and change how people with disabilities are portrayed in media.  Despite facing bullying and judgment, Dayna wants to be seen as a typical teenager, emphasizing her ability to drive, attend college, and dance, defying initial medical expectations.  She now also does motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City has inquired about acquiring Javier Hernandez from Manchester United.  Hernandez is also wanted by eight European clubs, including Southampton, Stoke City, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, and Inter Milan. Manchester United wants around £8 million for Hernandez.  Meanwhile, Manchester United has offered Andreas Pereira a revised contract after he rejected their initial offer.  Pereira has interest from Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord.

In Los Angeles early Saturday morning, a driver and his two passengers escaped injury after an altercation with at least three people at a gas station. The suspects allegedly attempted to carjack the driver, then doused his white Dodge Charger with gasoline and set it on fire.  The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson, using surveillance video as evidence. The suspects remain at large.

Iowa chiropractor Charles Manuel surrendered his license after admitting to exchanging services for sex with patients, performing exorcisms, and recommending patients stop taking prescribed medications.  He agreed not to seek reinstatement for at least 10 years.  Despite these actions, he received positive patient satisfaction reviews online.

A Russian SU-27 Flanker intercepted a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance aircraft over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. alleges the Russian pilot acted unsafely and unprofessionally due to aggressive maneuvers and high speed near the U.S. aircraft. Russia claims the U.S. plane was flying toward the Russian border with its transponder off, which the U.S. denies.  Similar incidents between these two types of aircraft have occurred before, including one over the Sea of Okhotsk.  The U.S. will complain to Russia through diplomatic channels.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle, secured inside a locked case in his vehicle, was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot shortly before President Obama's visit to Utah.  The thief broke the car window and ripped the rifle case free, also stealing bags, clothing, and tools. Some items were recovered at a nearby hotel, but the rifle remains missing.  The hotel lacked surveillance cameras, but the rifle's serial number has been entered into a national database.  The Secret Service was notified of the theft.

In 2012, 71-year-old Luigi Costa allegedly murdered his neighbor, Terrence Freebody, in Canberra, Australia.  Costa is accused of stomping on Freebody's head, cutting his throat, and stabbing him multiple times. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen testified that Costa's dementia and alcohol abuse likely compromised his mental state during the attack. Evidence of Costa's declining mental state includes his erratic behavior during the 911 call and a trail of feces.  Costa's mental state is critical to the case, as the jury can return a not guilty verdict if his unstable mindset at the time of the attack is proven.

Ross Barkley took a penalty kick instead of Leighton Baines, the usual penalty taker for Everton, and missed.  Manager Roberto Martinez defended Barkley's decision, stating that Lukaku would have taken it if he were on the field, and that he's comfortable with multiple players taking penalties depending on how they feel.  Baines willingly gave Barkley the responsibility. Though Barkley's penalty was saved, Mirallas scored later to secure Everton's 1-0 win against Burnley.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the ms Ryndam at 11:30 a.m. Thursday in what appears to be a murder-suicide.  The ship left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 on a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico.  Authorities, including the FBI, are investigating.

Curacao, coached by Patrick Kluivert, advanced to the second round of CONCACAF World Cup qualifying for the 2018 tournament. They drew 2-2 with Montserrat on Tuesday for a 4-3 aggregate win.  Curacao will next face Cuba on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso believes avoiding relegation with Leicester City would be comparable to winning a major trophy, given the team's current position at the bottom of the Premier League.  Despite the difficult situation, Cambiasso remains confident in his team's ability to secure enough points to stay in the league. While happy with his decision to join Leicester and his family's adjustment, his future with the club beyond his current one-year contract remains uncertain.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, may be banned from seeing her children due to excessive drinking, partying, and drug use.  Her mother, Debbie, who has cared for the children since they were four months old, is threatening the ban after Gemma allegedly stole an iPad from one of the children.  Debbie claims Gemma has been irresponsible since age 13 and prioritizes partying over her children, who call Debbie "mum".  Gemma admits to past thefts from her mother.

Chelsea’s first goal against Manchester United, scored by Eden Hazard, was deemed controversial by Sky Sports pundits.  John Terry's challenge on Radamel Falcao, which led to the goal, was considered a foul by Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp, and Graeme Souness.  Souness believed Terry's elbow made contact with Falcao's head, while Henry and Redknapp agreed that, despite Falcao potentially being able to stay on his feet, a foul should have been called.

Hillary Scott, of Lady Antebellum, along with her husband, tour manager, and driver, were safely evacuated from their tour bus after it caught fire on a Texas freeway.  A blown tire is suspected to be the cause of the fire, which destroyed everything in the back lounge of the bus except for Scott's Bible.  The band's other members were not on board.  Lady Antebellum is still scheduled to perform at the Academy of Country Music Awards on Sunday.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman of Dundee University is developing space lasers to convert sunlight into energy that can be beamed to Earth.  Satellites with mirrors will orbit the earth, collect sunlight, convert it to laser light, and send it to solar panels to boost energy.  While successful initial trials took place in Scotland, future tests are planned for Portugal.  These lasers are not powerful enough to be used as weapons, unlike lasers proposed by Tokyo researchers to clear space junk from orbit.  However, Dr. Quarterman acknowledges potential concerns about who controls the satellites.

54-year-old Stephen Munden, a convicted pedophile, escaped from a psychiatric facility near Hook, Hampshire.  He was last seen leaving the hospital around 6:15 pm on Tuesday. Munden, who has learning difficulties, was committed under the Mental Health Act after being convicted of sexually touching a three-year-old girl on a bus. Police believe he may have shaved his beard and are urging anyone with information to contact them immediately.

V. Stiviano must return over $2.6 million in gifts to Donald Sterling's wife, Shelly Sterling, after a judge ruled in favor of Shelly Sterling's lawsuit.  Shelly Sterling accused Stiviano of manipulating older, wealthy men and using Donald Sterling’s money to purchase luxury items. Stiviano argued she did nothing wrong in accepting the gifts.  Donald Sterling’s downfall began after a recording surfaced of him making racist remarks to Stiviano about her social media posts with African Americans, leading to his ban from the NBA and a $2.5 million fine.

Thierry Henry believes Arsenal need to buy four players (a goalkeeper, center back, defensive midfielder, and a top striker) to win the Premier League title.  He questioned whether Olivier Giroud is the striker to lead Arsenal to a title, citing Chelsea's success after acquiring Courtois, Matic, Fabregas, and Costa.  Henry contends that internal competition, like at Chelsea, is essential for winning the league.

Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn pleaded guilty to 12 sex offenses, including persistent sexual abuse of a child. One victim testified in court about the severe impact of the abuse, including fear for future relationships, not understanding why she was targeted, and attempting suicide after Van Ryn's arrest.  She kept the abuse secret for years until she learned of his arrest.  The victim suffers from depression, self-harm, and suicidal thoughts and is fearful of Van Ryn's release.

Serge Gnabry, 19, is nearing a return to Arsenal after a serious knee injury sidelined him for over a year.  After playing 90 minutes for Arsenal U21s twice in one week, he feels “better and better” and is looking forward to playing again.

23-year-old Jacob Phillips died after falling down a 70ft cliff in Penarth, South Wales.  He had been out drinking with friends and took a taxi, but they didn't have enough money for the fare.  Upon arriving in Penarth, the group exited the taxi under the pretense of using an ATM, then ran in different directions to avoid paying.  Phillips ran into the dark, unaware of the cliff edge, and fell. His body was found the next day by a dog walker. The coroner ruled his death accidental.

Thousands of travelers affected by passport delays last summer did not receive compensation, despite the passport agency making a £42 million profit and awarding managers up to £3,500 in bonuses.  Only 2,191 out of thousands of compensation applications were approved, totaling £203,066 with an average payout of £92.68.  Ministers rejected blanket refunds, citing precedent, leaving many travelers, like Mathew Bean and Hayley Kirkham,  out of pocket for missed trips and upgrade fees.

A Bristol home, untouched since the 1930s, is going up for auction on April 30.  The house retains original features, including stained-glass windows, an oil-fired heating system, a mint green and black bathroom, and even vintage food tins.  While some upgrades like double glazing exist, the extensive renovations needed might deter developers.  The guide price is between £200,000 and £250,000.

Colin Kaepernick started his career as a backup quarterback, but took over as the 49ers’ starter midway through the 2012 season after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. Kaepernick remained the starter, leading the team to Super Bowl XLVII, where they lost to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food, a 1997 American comedy-drama film, was produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds, and Robert Teitel, and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans and lived there and in Texas before moving to San Francisco.  Route 495 in Hudson County, New Jersey, connects the New Jersey Turnpike (I-95) to NY 495 and Midtown Manhattan via the Lincoln Tunnel.
Telemundo, pronounced [teleˈmundo], is a Spanish-language terrestrial television network in America owned by Comcast through NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises, a division of NBCUniversal.

Damon Albarn, raised in East London and Essex, formed the band Blur with Graham Coxon. Blur’s debut album *Leisure* was released in 1991.  Albarn’s debut solo album *Everyday Robots* was released in 2014 and featured collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan, and the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir.
Mogadishu (Muqdisho, مقديشو), also known as Hamar, is Somalia's capital and most populous city.  Many important national institutions are located there.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a Nine Inch Nails song from their 1992 debut EP *Broken*.
American screenwriter Andrew Kevin Walker, born August 14, 1964, was nominated for a BAFTA.

The 2007 film *Shooter* follows Force Recon veteran Bob Lee Swagger, who is framed for murder.  A TV series, also called *Shooter*, features the same lead character, now living in exile and coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
House, also known as House, M.D., is an American television medical drama that ran on Fox for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004, to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, including actress Sharon Tate, carried out by members of his group. He also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald "Shorty" Shea.  After he was charged, recordings of his music were commercially released.

Sean Penn is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He started his acting career in 1974 and his film debut was in 1981. After various roles, he gained recognition for his roles in At Close Range (1986), State of Grace (1990), and Carlito's Way (1993). Penn's prominent leading actor status came with Dead Man Walking (1995), which earned him his first Academy Award nomination and the Best Actor Award at the Berlin Film Festival.  He received two more Oscar nominations before winning Best Actor awards in 2003 for Mystic River and in 2008 for Milk.

Sir Donald George "Don" Bradman (1908-2001), nicknamed "The Don", was an Australian cricketer considered the greatest batsman of all time.  Following retirement, he remained influential as a cricket administrator, selector, and writer.
L.A. Reid was the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, Arista Records, and the Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk, drummer for Rage Against the Machine (1991-2000; 2007-11) and Audioslave (2001-07), started his career in 1990 drumming for Greta.  He co-founded Rage Against the Machine with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in 1991. As of 2016, Wilk plays in Prophets of Rage.  Rage is a German heavy metal band formed in 1984.
The Millers was a multi-camera series that aired 34 episodes over two seasons on CBS, from October 3, 2013 to July 18, 2015.  CBS cancelled the show on November 14, 2014, during its second season.

Ann Richards (1933-2006) was the 45th Governor of Texas (1991-1995).  A Democrat, she gained national attention for her keynote address at the 1988 Democratic National Convention.  She was the second female governor of Texas and known for her outspoken feminism.  A different Ann Richards (1935-1982) was a jazz singer and wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Drake Bell independently released an EP titled *A Reminder* in 2011.

Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh (1927-2004) was an American actress, singer, dancer, and author who wrote four books, including two novels, between 1984 and 2002.

Simón Bolívar (1783-1830), also known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who was instrumental in establishing Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama as independent states, free from Spanish rule.
The Bermuda Triangle, an area in the western North Atlantic Ocean, is where several aircraft and ships have reportedly disappeared mysteriously.

Colin Kaepernick started his career as a backup quarterback, but became the 49ers’ starter midway through the 2012 season after Alex Smith suffered a concussion.  He led the team to Super Bowl XLVII and the NFC Championship game in the 2012 and 2013 seasons, respectively, losing both games.
*Marnie*, a 1964 American psychological thriller film, was directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a sponsored, nonpersonal message promoting a product, service, or idea, delivered via mass media like newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor ads, direct mail, or newer media like search results, blogs, websites, and text messages.  It differs from personal selling due to its nonpersonal nature.
*Private Lives*, a 1930 comedy of manners in three acts by Noël Coward, was adapted into a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.
Harold Macmillan (1894-1986) was a British Conservative politician and statesman. He was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from January 10, 1957 to October 19, 1963.

Aristotle (384–322 BC), a Greek philosopher and scientist born in Stagira, joined Plato’s Academy in Athens at seventeen or eighteen and remained there until thirty-seven.  After Plato's death, Aristotle left Athens and tutored Alexander the Great starting in 343 BC at the request of Philip II of Macedon.
David Packouz (born February 16, 1982) is a former arms dealer, musician, and inventor.  He invented the BeatBuddy guitar pedal drum machine and is the CEO of Singular Sound.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons.  He won a championship and NBA Finals MVP in his rookie season, and four more championships in the 1980s.  He retired in 1991 after announcing he had HIV, returned in 1992, and retired again for four years.  He returned in 1996 to play 32 games before retiring for the final time.  In 2009, Ebony magazine named him one of America's most influential black businessmen.  He has numerous business interests and was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years.

Tenacious D, formed in Los Angeles in 1994, consists of Jack Black and Kyle Gass.  They have released three albums: *Tenacious D* (2001), *The Pick of Destiny* (2006), and *Rize of the Fenix* (2012).  The band's popularity began with their 1997 TV series and subsequent supporting roles for major rock acts.

James VI and I ruled Scotland as James VI starting in 1567 and England and Ireland as James I beginning in 1603 until his death in 1625.  Although ruled by James, Scotland and England remained separate sovereign states with their own parliaments, judiciaries, and laws.  James strongly advocated for a single parliament but was met with resistance in England, including the Gunpowder Plot and ongoing conflict with Parliament.

Big Brother 2017 (Big Brother 18), hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley, is the 18th series of the British reality television show.  Marcus Bentley is a British actor and voice-over artist famous for narrating the UK's Big Brother since 2000 on Channel 4 and continuing on Channel 5.  His distinct Geordie accent has made him one of Britain's most recognizable voices.

Saxony, a landlocked German state, borders Brandenburg, Saxony-Anhalt, Thuringia, Bavaria, Poland, and the Czech Republic.  It's the tenth largest state by area (18,413 km2) and sixth most populous (4 million).  Saxony is also a wine region, one of Germany's two wine regions located in former East Germany, and among the northernmost in Europe.
East End Park was a major league baseball park in Cincinnati, Ohio.  "In the End" is a song by Linkin Park.
Mel B (Brown) launched her solo career with the release of "I Want You Back" featuring Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and the younger sister of Miley and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra, a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai, starred Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah. Released on July 1, 1994, it became the second-highest-grossing Indian film of that year, receiving nine Filmfare nominations in 1995.  Initially, Divya Bharti was cast as the female lead, but after her death, Raveena Tandon replaced her.  The film is also known for its hit songs.
"Hourglass" is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure and the fourteenth studio album by singer-songwriter James Taylor.
Shane Black (born December 16, 1961) is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor known for writing the 1987 action film Lethal Weapon and directing the 2005 film Kiss Kiss Bang Bang.
A View to a Kill (1985), the fourteenth film in the James Bond series and Roger Moore's seventh and final appearance as James Bond.
Papua, the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, makes up most of western New Guinea.  It was formerly called Irian Jaya, and before that, West Irian or Irian Barat.
Augustus likely died of natural causes, though rumors circulated that his wife, Livia, poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez debuted in music in 1999. In 2001, she became the first woman to have a number one album and film in the same week. After her second divorce, she had a high-profile relationship with Ben Affleck, which influenced her third studio album.  After marrying Marc Anthony, she had twins in 2008.  In 2011, she became a judge on American Idol and released her most commercially successful single “On the Floor”.

Working animals are typically domesticated animals trained to perform tasks.  These tasks can range from assisting humans (like guide dogs) to providing labor (like draft horses) or participating in activities like milking or herding.  While wild animals can sometimes be trained, they are less reliable and typically used for entertainment.

Billboard Dad is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film directed by Alan Metter and starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Billboard magazine publishes the Top Latin Albums chart, the most important music chart for Spanish language albums in the American music market. Billboard also publishes the weekly genre-specific Regional Mexican Albums chart.

Vedam, a 2010 Telugu-language Indian drama film, was written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi. The film starred Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, Anushka Shetty, Manoj Bajpayee, Saranya Ponvannan, Deeksha Seth, Lekha Washington, and Siya Gautham.
*MIB II*, a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film, stars Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub, and Rip Torn.
Sancho Panza is Don Quixote’s squire in the 1605 novel *Don Quixote* by Miguel de Cervantes.  His commentary, called “sanchismos,” combines humor, Spanish proverbs, and wit.
The 2002 Australian-American sci-fi action comedy film *The Adventures of Pluto Nash*, directed by Ron Underwood, stars Eddie Murphy in a dual role.
Hedda Gabler premiered on January 31, 1891, at the Residenztheater in Munich, with Ibsen in attendance.
Brazzers, pronounced  [ ˈbræzərz ], is a pornographic production company located in Montreal, Canada.
Tim Roth, born May 14, 1961, is an English actor and director.

Juventus Football Club S.p.A., colloquially known as Juve, is a professional Italian association football club based in Turin.  Founded in 1897 by Torinese students, including Eugenio Canfari (first president) and his brother Enrico, it is the second oldest active Italian football club after Genoa.  Juventus has traditionally worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903 and currently plays in the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis had supporting and minor roles in film and television in the late 1990s and early 2000s.  Some of her work includes Kate & Leopold (2001), Far From Heaven (2002), and Law & Order: Special Victims Unit.

Jenna Jameson (born April 9, 1974) is an American entrepreneur, webcam model, and former pornographic film actress known as the world's most famous adult entertainment performer and "The Queen of Porn."  She began her career in 1993 after working as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans are an NBA team competing in the Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade, a professional wrestling event held by the NWA and later WCW, ran from 1983-2000.  Originally broadcast via closed-circuit television, it later aired on pay-per-view.  From the 1960s-1980s, JCP traditionally held major wrestling events on Thanksgiving and Christmas.  The 1985, 1987, and 1997 Starrcades were the third, fifth, and fifteenth annual events respectively.
Jack Falahee (born February 20, 1989) is an American actor known for his roles as Connor Walsh on ABC's *How to Get Away with Murder* and Benjamin Stringfellow on PBS's *Mercy Street*.

Seohyun, a South Korean singer and actress, debuted as a member of Girls' Generation in August 2007.  She has also acted in musicals such as Moon Embracing the Sun, Gone with the Wind, and Mamma Mia.  Her solo debut mini album, Don't Say No, was released on January 17, 2017, making her the third Girls' Generation member to debut as a solo artist.

The Apple II, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak with contributions from Steve Jobs and Rod Holt, was one of the first successful mass-produced microcomputers. Introduced in 1977 by Apple Computer, the 8-bit home computer was part of a family of microcomputer products.  Wozniak, also known as "Woz," is an American inventor, electronics engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and technology entrepreneur who co-founded Apple Inc.

A&E, formerly Arts & Entertainment Network, is an American cable and satellite television channel and the flagship property of A&E Networks. A&E Networks is jointly owned by Hearst Corporation and Disney -- ABC Television Group, a subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company.  Each company has a 50% ownership interest.

L.A. Reid was the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, president and CEO of Arista Records, and chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group. He also founded and served as CEO of Hitco Music Publishing and co-founded LaFace Records.

Veeram, meaning Valour, is the title of two Indian films.  One is a 2014 Tamil action film, directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions. The other is a 2016 epic historical drama, written and directed by Jayaraj.

Home for the Holidays is the title of two films. The 1972 version, directed by John Llewellyn Moxey and produced by Aaron Spelling, starred Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter, and Walter Brennan.  It premiered on ABC. The 1995 version starred Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton, and David Strathairn.
Taran Killam is an American actor, comedian, and writer born on April 1, 1982.
Eight men and eight women compete in *The Sex Factor*, an online reality TV series produced by xHamster, to become a porn star.
John Dolmayan, born July 15, 1973, is a Lebanese-born Armenian-American songwriter and drummer.
Island Records, a British-American record label, is part of Universal Music Group (UMG).
Sikkim is a state in northeastern India.
Christa McAuliffe became a social studies teacher at Concord High School, New Hampshire in 1983.
Ron Weasley is a fictional character in J. K. Rowling's *Harry Potter* series.
Reign Over Me is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder, produced by Jack Binder, and distributed by Columbia Pictures.
Colin Kaepernick, born November 3, 1987, is an American football quarterback and free agent.
Sheryl Lee appeared in *Café Society* and reprised her role as Laura Palmer in the 2017 *Twin Peaks* revival.  Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in the 2016 Broadway production of *Wicked*.
Matteo Renzi (born January 11, 1975) served as Italy's Prime Minister from February 2014 to December 2016.
"The Road to El Dorado" stars Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Armand Assante, Jim Cummings, Edward James Olmos, Tobin Bell, and Rosie Perez.

"Same Old Love" is a song by Selena Gomez from her second studio album, *Revival* (2015), which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The song was one of *Revival’s* first three singles, all of which topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the US.
Weekly Idol is hosted by comedian Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal, a rock music genre, originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s in the UK and the US.  Later, in the late 1970s, new wave British heavy metal bands like Iron Maiden and Saxon continued the genre's development.
Ashton Kutcher starred in several romantic comedies, including *Guess Who* (2005), *A Lot Like Love* (2005), *What Happens in Vegas* (2008), and *No Strings Attached* (2011).
Topman, a UK-based men's clothing store chain owned by Arcadia Group, has locations throughout the UK and Ireland.  Arcadia also owns Burton, Miss Selfridge, Wallis, Evans, and Dorothy Perkins.

At the start of the Industrial Revolution, Wales transitioned from an agricultural to an industrial society due to growth in the mining and metallurgical industries.  Exploitation of the South Wales Coalfield caused rapid population expansion.
Tool is a band that has won three Grammy Awards, performed worldwide tours, and produced chart-topping albums in several countries.
YouTube, an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California, is the second most popular website globally according to Alexa Internet.
Sidse Babett Knudsen (born 22 November 1968) is a Danish actress who works in theater, television, and film.

Conrad Dunn began his screen career in the 1981 film *Stripes* as Francis "Psycho" Soyer.  This film also featured the first significant roles for actors John Larroquette, John Diehl, and Judge Reinhold.
The film *Raees* stars Shah Rukh Khan, Mahira Khan, and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.
Asylum Records is a US record label that was founded in 1971 by David Geffen and Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American computer-animated fantasy television series created for Netflix by Guillermo del Toro, produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Ottoman government systematically exterminated 1.5 million Armenians, mostly citizens within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey.  Other indigenous and Christian ethnic groups, including Assyrians and Ottoman Greeks, were similarly targeted, with some historians considering these acts part of the same genocidal policy.
Marcus Morgan Bentley (born 4 October 1967) is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist.

Bill Clinton, born August 19, 1946, served as the 42nd President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. His first inauguration was held on January 20, 1993, at the US Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.

Danny Boyle, born October 20, 1956, is an English director, producer, screenwriter, and theatre director. His work includes *Shallow Grave*, *Trainspotting*, *The Beach*, *28 Days Later*, *Sunshine*, *Slumdog Millionaire*, *127 Hours*, and *Steve Jobs*. *The Beach*, a 2000 adventure drama, was directed by Boyle, based on Alex Garland's 1996 novel and adapted by John Hodge.
More than 10 million tweets used hashtags such as #thedress, #whiteandgold, and #blackandblue in the first week after the image of the dress appeared online.
Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand MC and bar (1917-2006) was a British Army officer.
Advertising is a sponsored, non-personal message, delivered via audio or visual media, used to promote or sell a product, service, or idea.

The Others (2001) won eight Goya Awards, including Best Film and Best Director.  It was the first English-language film to win Best Film at the Goyas, despite having no Spanish dialogue. It was also nominated for six Saturn Awards, winning three for Best Horror Film, Best Actress (Nicole Kidman), and Best Supporting Actress (Fionnula Flanagan).
Ralph Fults (1911-1993) was a Depression-era outlaw and escape artist associated with the Barrow Gang, including Raymond Hamilton, Bonnie Parker, and Clyde Barrow.

The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, was born in 1935 in Taktser village, Tibet.  He was selected as the tulku of the 13th Dalai Lama in 1937 and formally recognized in 1939.  Following the 1959 Tibetan uprising, he fled to India, where he currently lives.
Four Buffalo Soldiers of the 92nd Infantry Division, seeking refuge in a Tuscan village during WWII, bond with the villagers.  This story is told in flashback by a survivor in 1980s New York.
Caroline Kennedy, born November 27, 1957, is an American author, attorney, and diplomat.  She was the U.S. Ambassador to Japan from 2013-2017.

The 1995 film *Home for the Holidays* stars Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton, and David Strathairn.
Anne Rice was born in New Orleans and lived there for part of her early life before moving to Texas and later, San Francisco.
Stephen Hillenburg was born in Lawton, Oklahoma, raised in Anaheim, California, and developed interests in the ocean and art as a child.

Mendicancy is a way of life followed by many religious orders, including Catholic mendicant orders, Hindu ascetics, some Sufi dervishes, and Jain and Buddhist monastic orders.  A monk (from μοναχός, monachos, "single, solitary," and Latin *monachus*) practices religious asceticism, living alone or with other monks, dedicating their life to serving others or to prayer and contemplation.
The Mod Squad, an American crime drama series, aired on ABC from 1968 to 1973.
The Dark Tower is an upcoming American science fantasy western action horror film directed and co-written by Nikolaj Arcel.

Arizona, the 48th state to join the United States, is the sixth largest and 14th most populous state.  Roughly 25% of its land consists of Indian reservations, home to 27 federally recognized Native American tribes, including the Navajo Nation (the largest in the US).
Smriti Mandhana, born July 18, 1996, is an Indian cricketer. She plays for the Indian women’s cricket team.

Born in Paris and raised in Oxfordshire, Emma Watson (born April 15, 1990) is a French-British actress, model, and activist.  She attended the Dragon School and trained at the Oxford branch of Stagecoach Theatre Arts.
Angela Bassett began her film career in the mid-1980s after graduating from Yale University with a bachelor of arts degree and receiving a master of fine arts degree from drama school.

The Congressional Space Medal of Honor, NASA’s highest award, is given by the President to astronauts who, under NASA’s authority, perform extraordinary accomplishments during space flights.  Colonel Frank Borman is one recipient.
The *Saw* film franchise has made over $873 million worldwide at the box office.
*Down with Love*, a romantic comedy, was released in 2003.
Paul Nicholls is best known for his roles as Joe Wicks in the BBC’s *EastEnders* and DS Sam Casey in ITV’s *Law & Order: UK*.
Colombiana, a 2011 French action film, was co-written and produced by Luc Besson and directed by Olivier Megaton.
Rick Yune was part of the main cast of Netflix's *Marco Polo* until its cancellation on December 12, 2016.

Kentucky is known for horse racing, bourbon distilleries, coal, the historic site My Old Kentucky Home, automobile manufacturing, tobacco, bluegrass music, college basketball, and Kentucky Fried Chicken.
Filmed over 11 years, *Boyhood* follows Mason Evans Jr. from ages 6 to 18 as he grows up in Texas with divorced parents.
*Hush* (2016) was produced by Trevor Macy (Intrepid Pictures) and Jason Blum (Blumhouse Productions).
The Penibaetic System, located in the southern Iberian Peninsula, is the southernmost of the Baetic System's three mountain ranges.

Bonobos is a men's clothing retailer that sells a full line of apparel and accessories. Topman, part of the Arcadia Group, is a UK-based high-street retailer of men's clothing with locations throughout the UK and Ireland.
"Roar," the lead single from Katy Perry's fourth studio album, *Prism* (2013), was released on August 10, 2013.
Saturn, also known as Saturn LLC, is a registered trademark of General Motors, established on January 7, 1985.

The Armenian Genocide was the systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians by the Ottoman government within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey. Turkey denies the use of the word genocide to describe these mass killings.
Muslims believe the Quran is God’s word, revealed to Muhammad by the angel Gabriel over 23 years, from Muhammad’s 40th year (609 CE) until his death in 632 CE.

The human brain, along with the spinal cord, forms the central nervous system.  It consists of the cerebrum (the largest part), brainstem, and cerebellum.  Located beneath the cerebrum's cortex are the thalamus, epithalamus, pineal gland, hypothalamus, pituitary gland, subthalamus, limbic structures (amygdala and hippocampus), claustrum, basal ganglia nuclei, basal forebrain structures, and three circumventricular organs.

*   2017 British comedy-drama film
*   Set in and around Edinburgh, Scotland.
AMGTV is an American family-oriented television network with programming that includes drama, sports, movies, entertainment, how-to, hunting and fishing, children's shows, and other features.

Sir Donald George "Don" Bradman (1908-2001), nicknamed "The Don", was an Australian cricketer considered the greatest batsman of all time.  Even after becoming reclusive in later years, his opinion was highly sought, and he remained a national icon.  Over 50 years after his retirement, Australian Prime Minister John Howard called him the "greatest living Australian".

Margaret Thatcher served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990.  She was the longest-serving British prime minister of the 20th century and the first woman to hold the office.  In 1975, she became the first woman to lead a major political party in the UK after defeating Heath in the Conservative Party leadership election.
Randy "Macho Man" Savage (1952-2011) was an American professional wrestler and color commentator known for his time in the WWF (now WWE) and WCW.
Alice Cooper (born Vincent Damon Furnier on February 4, 1948) is an American singer, songwriter, and actor with a career spanning over 50 years.
EA Black Box, formerly Black Box Games, was a Canadian video game developer founded in 1998 by former Radical Entertainment employees.  It was later acquired by Electronic Arts.

Baiae, a resort town on the Gulf of Naples, and Herculaneum, destroyed in 79 AD, are historically significant sites near Naples, along with Pompeii and the Palace of Caserta.  Famous ruins exist globally, including sites in China, the Indus Valley, Judea, Zimbabwe, the Mediterranean basin, and the Americas.

No Country for Old Men, starring Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem, and Josh Brolin, is a cat-and-mouse drama about a Texas welder and Vietnam veteran in 1980 West Texas.  Tommy Lee Jones also starred as Texas Ranger Woodrow F. Call in Lonesome Dove, Agent K in Men in Black, and Sheriff Ed Tom Bell in No Country for Old Men.
Palo Alto, California, meaning "tall tree," is a charter city located in the northwest corner of Santa Clara County.

Albert Lawrence Brooks (born Albert Lawrence Einstein on July 22, 1947) is an American actor, filmmaker, author, and comedian.  He acted in *Finding Dory*, which was directed by Andrew Stanton and co-directed by Angus MacLane, with a screenplay by Stanton and Victoria Strouse.

Morse code transmits text as a series of on-off signals (tones, lights, or clicks) that can be understood without special equipment.  Character length is inversely proportional to its frequency in English, allowing for faster communication.  Morse code is less susceptible to poor signal conditions than voice, and can be sent by improvised methods, making it simple and versatile.
Alexandra Daddario, born March 16, 1986, is an American actress.

A 6.5 magnitude earthquake struck northeastern Afghanistan on December 12, 2005, at 21:47 (UTC).  The earthquake occurred in the Hindu Kush mountain range, an 800 km range spanning the Afghan-Pakistan border.  The highest peak in the Hindu Kush is Tirich Mir (7708 m) in Pakistan.
As of 2015, Ripon College (Wisconsin) had approximately 840 students, most of whom resided on campus.

Fox Sports is a global brand of sports channels, broadcasts, and other media controlled or partially owned by Rupert Murdoch's family through the Murdoch Family Trust.  After the split of News Corporation in 2013, the Murdoch family retained ownership in both successor companies, News Corp and 21st Century Fox.
Wildfang, a US-based women's apparel company, sells tomboy-style clothing.
American blues singer Bessie Smith lived from April 15, 1894, to September 26, 1937.

Speech recognition (SR) is a sub-field of computational linguistics that uses methodologies and technologies from linguistics, computer science, and electrical engineering to enable computers to recognize and translate spoken language into text.
Aleister Crowley (1875-1947) was an English occultist, ceremonial magician, poet, painter, novelist, and mountaineer.
Poldark is a British-American drama television series that premiered on BBC One on March 8, 2015.
Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, starring Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol, was released on October 20, 1995.  Filming took place in India, London, and Switzerland between September 1994 and August 1995.
Timothy Simon Roth (born May 14, 1961) is an English actor and director.  Tim Roth (born December 6, 1975) is a Canadian musician, the guitarist and backing vocalist for the band Into Eternity.
Tatum O'Neal married tennis player John McEnroe in 1986, and they had three children.

Sean Penn won two Academy Awards for his roles in Mystic River (2003) and Milk (2008).  After his debut in Taps (1981), Penn gained recognition for roles in At Close Range (1986), State of Grace (1990), and Carlito's Way (1993). He became a leading actor with Dead Man Walking (1995), earning his first Oscar nomination and the Best Actor Award at the Berlin Film Festival.  He received two more Oscar nominations for Sweet and Lowdown (1999) and I Am Sam (2001). His film Into the Wild (2007) received critical acclaim and two Oscar nominations.

Volcanic outgassing created Earth’s primordial atmosphere and ocean.  Initially, the atmosphere lacked oxygen.  As Earth cooled, a solid crust formed, allowing liquid water to exist on the surface.  Plate tectonics shapes the oceans and continents, while changes in the biosphere, now dominated by human activity, significantly affect Earth’s systems.  Water covers 71% of Earth’s surface.
Nuuk (pronounced [ nuːk ]; also known as Godthåb) is Greenland's capital and largest city, and the municipality of Sermersooq.

How to Train Your Dragon 2, written and directed by Dean DeBlois, features returning voice actors Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Craig Ferguson, America Ferrera, Jonah Hill, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, T.J. Miller, and Kristen Wiig. New additions to the cast include Cate Blanchett as Valka, Djimon Hounsou as Drago, and Kit Harington.

Down with Love, a 2003 romantic comedy film directed by Peyton Reed, stars Renée Zellweger and Ewan McGregor. The film is a pastiche of 1950s/60s sex comedies starring Doris Day and Rock Hudson, such as Pillow Talk, Lover Come Back, and Send Me No Flowers.  A Taiwanese television series of the same name ran from January 31, 2010, to May 23, 2010, on CTV and from February 2, 2010, to May 30, 2010, on GTV.
Paris Hilton's self-titled album blends hip hop and R&B, along with reggae, soul, and pop rock influences.
