The show featured monochrome designs, modeled in the empty pool and along the break wall. The brand, led by Icebergs restaurateur Maurice Terzini, produces collections of ten pieces designed to be worn in twenty different ways. Guests enjoyed refreshments and sunshine during the show.

Amir Khan, a boxer from Bolton, spent Friday at a safari park in Northern California with his wife, Faryal Makhdoom Khan, and daughter, Lamysa.  He posed with and fed a white tiger, giraffes, and sea lions.  Khan recently announced his upcoming welterweight fight against Chris Algieri on May 30th, despite pressure to fight Kell Brook.

Sixteen-year-old Palestinian, Mohammed Abu Khdeir, was added to Israel’s memorial wall for fallen soldiers and terror victims. His family and Almagor, an organization for terror victims, objected to his inclusion.  His father, Hussein Abu Khdeir, stated he was not asked permission and refuses to have his son listed among “soldiers of the occupation.” Almagor described the teen’s death as a rogue attack, not a terror attack.  Following complaints, the National Insurance Institute of Israel removed Abu Khdeir’s name from the memorial wall and website.  Three suspects are currently on trial for the teen’s murder.

A young boy repeatedly attempts to use his family cat as a pillow.  He follows the cat around the garden, plopping his head on the cat's belly each time the cat settles down.  After several attempts, the cat goes inside. A later video shows the boy and cat reconciled, with the boy feeding the cat treats.

Robert Kushner, a witness in a Philadelphia police corruption trial, lost his coaching job at Jack M. Barrack Hebrew Academy after testifying about his past as a marijuana dealer.  He testified against officers accused of stealing from him during a 2007 arrest.  Kushner’s past arrests, including a 2011 arrest and a 2008 DUI, came to light after his testimony, leading to his dismissal.  He maintains his innocence in the 2011 case.  The defense lawyers in the corruption trial claim the government’s case relies on dishonest drug dealers and a corrupt ex-officer.

An explosion at a paraxylene (px) chemical plant in Zhangzhou, China, injured six people. The blast, caused by an oil leak at an oil storage facility, ignited a large fire.  Over 600 firefighters contained the blaze. Though no toxic chemical spill was reported, five of the injured were hospitalized due to broken glass.  This same plant experienced a similar explosion in 2013.  The plant’s initial proposed location in Xiamen was changed after 2007 protests over pollution concerns.

Jack Grealish, Aston Villa teenager, wears his socks low due to superstition and will continue to do so despite referees telling him to pull them up.  He wears children's shin guards and hasn't received a kick to his shins yet.  His first premier league start was in a 3-3 draw against QPR.  He was pleased to finally get his first start and hopes to start in more games this season.

Bobbi Kristina Brown, daughter of Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston, has irreversible brain damage and remains unresponsive, according to her grandmother, Cissy Houston.  A source confirmed Brown's unchanging neurological state, noting her lack of responsiveness and a tracheostomy. While Bobby Brown recently stated his daughter was awake and watching him, his attorney clarified that her long-term prognosis remains uncertain, though doctors anticipate a long life.  She has left ICU and begun rehabilitation.

Russia leads Germany 2-0 in the Fed Cup after Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova defeated Sabine Lisicki 4-6, 7-6 (4), 6-3, saving a match point in the second set.  Svetlana Kuznetsova also won her match against Julia Goerges in straight sets.  Russia needs one more win to secure their first Fed Cup title since 2008.

Residents of New South Wales are bracing for more floods and damage as another storm system, similar to the one that occurred last week, is predicted to hit later this week, bringing heavy rain from Thursday to Saturday.  The State Emergency Service (SES), still working through over 4,000 unresolved jobs from the previous storm, is concerned about further hampering clean-up efforts, particularly in the Hunter region, which was significantly impacted.  While the upcoming storm is expected to be quicker than the last, with potentially two days of rain, the SES urges residents to prepare their homes and families.  The heaviest rainfall is anticipated in the far northern parts of the state and southeast Queensland, with coastal areas in the northeast also expected to be impacted. The Bureau of Meteorology notes it's too early to determine the severity of the system.  The SES is working to complete outstanding tasks and has over 1,000 personnel in the field, including 200 from other states.

Nina Moric, a model who appeared in Ricky Martin's "La Vida Loca" video, denied Italian media reports that she attempted suicide.  Ms. Moric stated on Instagram that she collapsed at home due to low blood pressure, hitting her head and bruising her arms.  She was treated at a hospital and is now recovering at home.  Her boyfriend, Luigi Mario Favoloso, who was in Naples at the time, was quoted by the media saying she had attempted suicide.  Ms. Moric was previously married to Fabrizio Corona, and they have a son together.

A poll by the Sunday Times reveals that the public favors traditional names for Kate and William’s second child.  Diana is the most popular choice (12%) if the baby is a girl, followed by Alice and Charlotte (9% each).  If it’s a boy, James (13%) and Alexander are favored.  Many hope for a girl, echoing similar sentiments on social media.  Additionally, the poll shows 68% support William’s six-week paternity leave.

A suicide bomber in Khost, Afghanistan killed 17 people and wounded 64 others near a protest against the provincial governor.  The Taliban denied responsibility for the attack, and no other group has claimed it.

Dani Alves will leave Barcelona this summer after 7 years with the club.  His agent and ex-wife, Dinorah Santana, confirmed Alves rejected Barcelona’s final contract offer of a 3-year extension contingent on him playing 60% of the club’s matches.  Santana stated that negotiations are over.

Pablo Osvaldo has implored Andrea Pirlo and Francesco Totti to join him at Boca Juniors.  He believes the two Italian legends would be a perfect fit for the Argentinian club and the fans would adore them.

18-year-old jockey Lewis Ferguson fell from his horse, Merrion Square, at Wincanton.  The fall, which involved a double somersault, has been viewed online hundreds of thousands of times.  Despite the dramatic incident, Ferguson only suffered a cut on his nose, was back working at the stables the next day, and plans to continue racing.

James Haskell, the London Wasps captain, celebrated the release of Avengers: Age of Ultron by posting a photo of himself dressed as Iron Man on Instagram.  Haskell, who rejoined Wasps in 2012 after stints with Stade Francais, Ricoh Black Rams, and Highlanders, first joined the club in 2002.  Since his return, he's made over 100 appearances for Wasps and earned 57 caps playing for England.

Wide-leg trousers are a key Spring/Summer 2015 trend.  They offer a welcome alternative to skinny jeans, though proper proportion is crucial for pulling off the look.  Heels, especially those with an exposed top of foot, create a lengthening effect and are a must, particularly with cropped styles.  Keep tops simple, such as a knit, shirt, or tee.  Denim is an easy entry point, as seen on the Gucci runway.  For other options, Topshop's Miller jean offers a high-street version, while Celine and Stella McCartney offer dressier styles.  Finery London provides similar looks at lower price points.

The University of Michigan reversed its decision to cancel a screening of “American Sniper” after more than 200 students signed a petition objecting to the film and a counter-petition urged the university to reconsider.  The university cited its commitment to freedom of expression and will also offer a screening of “Paddington” for students who prefer not to watch “American Sniper.”

Two French tourists, aged 18 and 24, attempted to set a quokka on fire on Rottnest Island, Western Australia on April 3rd.  The quokka survived with minor burns. The men were charged with animal cruelty and will appear in court on April 17th.

102-year-old Alice Barker, a former dancer at iconic New York nightclubs like the Cotton Club and Cafe Zanzibar, had never seen herself dancing due to lost memorabilia and footage. Filmmakers and volunteers compiled "soundies" (early music videos) featuring Barker, allowing her to finally watch herself perform.  She was delighted by the experience.

A recent survey indicates that washing one's car, previously a common Sunday activity, is declining in Britain.  One-third of men and three-quarters of women never wash their own cars, opting instead for professional car washes.  Several factors contribute to this trend, including Sunday shopping, televised sports, readily available hand car washes, and the larger size of modern vehicles.  Although more cars are washed by owners during holiday breaks, one in four admit to doing so merely as an excuse to leave the house.  Regional and brand-based variations exist regarding car washing frequency.

Liverpool’s Martin Skrtel has commended Steven Gerrard's influence on him since joining Anfield in 2008.  Skrtel feels that Gerrard remains a top player, synonymous with Liverpool,  and that his departure will change the club.  He credits Gerrard for helping him acclimate to Liverpool. While acknowledging the difficulty of replacing Gerrard, Skrtel believes Liverpool has players capable of filling the void and plans to support them. Both players may return to the lineup for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving three-match bans.

75-year-old Jack Nicklaus hit a hole-in-one on the fourth hole during the Par-3 contest at Augusta National.  Playing with Gary Player and Ben Crenshaw, this was his first ace at Augusta.  While Camilo Villegas also hit two holes-in-one (on the fourth and eighth holes), Kevin Streelman won the contest.  Nicklaus won his first Masters in 1963 and his sixth in 1986.

Wednesday night, Kansas faced several tornado-producing storms. One was spotted near Goddard, while others were reported in southwestern Kansas, including three near Aetna.  Nighttime tornadoes, according to CNN severe weather expert Chad Myers, are the most dangerous.  Storms also impacted Missouri, with a possible tornado touchdown in Potosi, causing wind damage, flooding, and hail. More storms are expected Thursday in the Midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley, and near the Southern Great Lakes.

Robert Bates, a reserve sheriff’s deputy in Oklahoma, pleaded not guilty to second-degree manslaughter for fatally shooting Eric Harris, claiming he mistook his gun for a taser.  A judge granted Bates permission to vacation in the Bahamas, upsetting Harris’s family. Bates’s preliminary hearing is scheduled for July 2.  His lawyer says the training records prove Bates’s qualifications, despite allegations of preferential treatment due to donations and friendship with the sheriff. Two deputies involved in the arrest have been reassigned due to threats.

Conor McGregor, who will challenge José Aldo for the featherweight title on July 11, has added a tiger tattoo to his stomach.  McGregor stated, "If you see the tiger, it's too late. You're food." He claims to have more motivation than Aldo, who will be making his eighth title defense.  McGregor previously snatched Aldo's belt at a Dublin promotional event.

Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott "skolled" a beer in six seconds at an Australian Rules event, sparking criticism from anti-drinking campaigners who say he is glorifying binge drinking and associating masculinity with alcohol consumption.  Critics argue that such actions promote a culture of rapid and excessive drinking rather than socializing.  While some, including Health Minister Sussan Ley, defended Abbott's actions, others point to the changing attitudes towards binge drinking and the prime minister's responsibility to set a positive example.  This is not the first time an Australian prime minister has publicly skolled a beer, with former Prime Minister Bob Hawke being a notable example.

Indiana's short-term needle exchange program, approved by Governor Mike Pence, has seen a rise in HIV cases in Scott County, increasing from 106 to 120 confirmed cases with 10 preliminary positives.  While the program has distributed 5,322 clean syringes to 86 participants and collected 1,400 used ones, the future of the program and similar legislation is uncertain.  Pence is reviewing the program's effectiveness and will decide on an extension next week.  Although the program has seen increased participation with a mobile unit, Pence opposes needle exchanges as anti-drug policy, and some lawmakers share his concerns.  Funding is also a concern, as the federal government bans public funding for these programs.

A devoted Arsenal fan created a 50-point test for his girlfriend about the club.  She scored 43.5/50 (87%), earning an 'A' grade and praise from her boyfriend, who jokingly stated he wouldn't dump her due to her passing grade.  The test included multiple-choice, fill-in-the-blank, and short answer questions about Arsenal players, history, and important matches.  Although impressed, her boyfriend pointed out areas for improvement, such as learning player positions.  Social media users reacted with amusement, labeling the boyfriend a "legend" and Saskia "proper gf material." Some criticized the boyfriend for his actions, while others were inspired to test their own partners' football knowledge.

Carlos Toro, 66, worked undercover for the DEA for 27 years after fleeing Colombia. He was promised US citizenship in exchange for his service, during which he helped take down cartel leaders and dictators. Now retired, Toro faces deportation and fears for his life if sent back to Colombia. The DEA refused to help with his citizenship after he publicized his situation.  A former colleague gave Toro $5,000 for an operation after the DEA declined to help. Toro's visa expired January 1, and he is now in legal limbo, unable to collect social security.

A 14-year-old girl in India set herself on fire after being allegedly gang-raped by five men from her village and being told by her family to keep quiet.  She is currently in critical condition at Safdarjung Hospital in Delhi. The accused men have been arrested.  This incident follows a heightened sensitivity around sexual assault in India after officials banned the documentary *India's Daughter*, about the 2012 Delhi gang rape and murder of Jyoti Singh.  Recent attacks have fueled protests and calls for greater protection of women.

Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal hopes to defeat Manchester City in Sunday’s derby at Old Trafford.  Van Gaal believes a win will improve United’s chances of finishing in the top three, exceeding their preseason goal. He acknowledges the difficulty of the challenge and the need to control aggression. Robin van Persie and Luke Shaw will not play due to injuries. Van Gaal is looking forward to experiencing the Old Trafford atmosphere for his first home derby.

Arsenal and Liverpool fans protested high ticket prices during the first 10 minutes of their match.  With the Premier League's new £5.14 billion TV deal, fans find the £64 minimum ticket price unreasonable.  Banners reading, "£5bn and what do we get? £64 a ticket," highlighted the issue.  Fan groups like Arsenal's Black Scarf Movement and Liverpool's Spirit of Shankly organized the protest, citing the increasing costs of following their teams. They believe the focus on money is hurting the working class fans and future generations of supporters.

Baby Star was diagnosed with biliary atresia, a life-threatening liver condition, shortly after birth.  After an unsuccessful surgery, a liver transplant was necessary.  Neither parent was a match, but the mother's twin sister, Shanell, donated part of her liver. Star underwent the transplant in November and has since recovered.  She requires ongoing blood tests and anti-rejection medication.

Chelsea players Eden Hazard, Nathan Ake, Loic Remy, and Willian participated in Audi's football challenge. Hazard and Ake teamed up against Remy and Willian.  In round one, Hazard and Ake won 5-3, kicking balls into a car boot. Next, they played tennis over a £127,000 Audi R8 V10 Plus, winning 6-0.  The final challenge involved long-range shots into a convertible Audi. Remy and Willian won this round, but Willian accidentally broke a wing mirror.

Robert Dellinger, a former Fortune 500 executive, stated he was not suicidal when he crashed his truck into an SUV, killing Amanda Murphy, Jason Timmons, and their unborn baby.  Dellinger pleaded guilty to negligent homicide and assault. He faces 12-24 years in prison and a wrongful death lawsuit.  Dellinger's lawyers claim he suffered from Ambien withdrawal, a psychiatric drug overdose, Prozac usage, and advanced MS symptoms. Prosecutors say he intentionally drove over the median at 100 mph. Dellinger's wife testified to his good character and health problems.  He took a $1 million severance package in 2011 for health reasons.

Lacey Spears, convicted of murdering her five-year-old son Garnett-Paul Spears by salt poisoning, was sentenced to 20 years to life in prison. The boy's father, Chris Hill, expressed outrage on Facebook, hoping she would die in prison. Spears' lawyer plans to appeal, claiming her innocence and blaming the hospital. Prosecutors argued that Spears, driven by a need for attention, caused her son's illnesses and death.  Spears' social media posts about Garnett-Paul's medical problems were used as evidence against her.

An improved flu vaccine is arriving in Australia one month later than expected due to the inclusion of two new strains, H3N2 and B/Phuket.  These strains caused increased deaths in Europe and the US because the previous vaccine did not protect against them.  The new vaccine will be available to high-risk groups starting April 20th.  Experts recommend everyone get the vaccine, which also protects against the H1N1 strain.

Abraham Lincoln's tomb in Springfield, Illinois, faces criticism from National Geographic for its appearance and struggles with budget cuts threatening its management.  Illinois Governor Bruce Rauner's proposal to restructure the state historic preservation agency coincides with the 150th anniversary of Lincoln's assassination.  Reduced hours, staffing, and a locked tomb door illustrate the impact of budget cuts.  Despite recent renovations exceeding $2.5 million, including interior and lighting upgrades, and ongoing waterproofing projects, National Geographic's critique describes the tomb as lacking historical character.  While some visitors agree with the criticism, others find the site impressive.

Nineties and noughties fashion trends are back. JNCO jeans, bucket hats, camouflage print, maximalist styling, Ugg boots, Daisy Dukes, Juicy Couture tracksuits, colored sunglasses, corset tops, and harem pants are discussed as trends that should stay in the past, along with examples of celebrities who wore them then and now.  Many celebrities who wore these trends in the nineties and noughties are mentioned, including Christina Aguilera, Rihanna, Beyoncé, Jourdan Dunn, Victoria Beckham, Britney Spears, Justin Timberlake, Kylie Jenner, Paris Hilton, Kristen Bell, Jessica Simpson, Miley Cyrus, Nicole Richie, Nicki Minaj, Cara Delevingne, Selena Gomez, Kim Kardashian, and Elle Macpherson.

Trending this week: A quadruple rainbow over New York City; China bans strippers from funerals; Robert Downey Jr. walks out of interview; the #KylieJennerChallenge goes viral; 102-year-old woman revisits her past; prom proposal rejected over bomb reference; Ewan McGregor cast in “Beauty and the Beast”; Johnny Depp’s transformation for “Black Mass” revealed; creative pregnancy announcements, including one referencing “The Fresh Prince”; and a military dad photobombs his son.

Serena Williams celebrated her 700th career victory with a giant cake at the Miami Open, after beating Sabine Lisicki 7-6, 1-6, 6-3.  Williams will play Simona Halep in the semi-final.  Andy Murray also celebrated his 500th win with cake at the same tournament.

Sabeen Mahmud, a Pakistani activist known for her outspokenness and promotion of free speech, was shot and killed in Karachi.  She hosted discussions on controversial topics, including the disappearances in Balochistan, a subject often silenced in mainstream media.  Mahmud's cafe, known as T2F or the Second Floor, was a haven for those seeking secular wisdom and open dialogue.  Her death sparked widespread grief and tributes celebrating her bravery and commitment to human rights.

Mangu Ram is an 82-year-old refugee who fled to Indian Kashmir 70 years ago during the partition of India. He, along with thousands of other West Pakistan Refugees (WPRs), are considered second-class citizens, unable to own property or vote.  With the recent rise of the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) to power in Kashmir, there is hope for change in their status.  The WPRs, primarily Hindu,  have been denied full citizenship rights due to concerns about upsetting the demographic balance in the Muslim-majority state.  Although Kashmir is prosperous, the approximately 18,000 WPR families live in poverty.  WPRs cannot access state-run training or government jobs.  While the BJP's presence in the governing coalition offers hope, activists like Labha Ram Gandhi warn they are prepared to fight for their rights if necessary.

Yoshinori Muto, forward for FC Tokyo, is considering an offer from Chelsea.  Muto wants to play regularly to reach his full potential, and is unsure if Chelsea is the right fit.  While Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho acknowledges Muto's talent, he also stated that Chelsea's transfer policy is influenced by financial and commercial interests, such as their sponsorship deal with Yokohama Rubber.  Former coach Ranko Popovic believes Muto has the potential to succeed at Chelsea due to his intelligence, speed, strength, and confidence.

Australia has revoked its policy of not selecting overseas players for the national team, allowing them to choose top talent like Matt Giteau and Drew Mitchell.  England should follow suit, enabling coach Stuart Lancaster to select the best players regardless of where they play, including those like Steffon Armitage and Nick Abendanon who have improved since moving to France.  Just as Jonny Wilkinson excelled in France,  players should be supported if they are happier and healthier abroad.  Winning the World Cup requires fielding the strongest team possible, and excluding overseas players weakens England's chances.  The RFU and Premier Rugby should not restrict selection.  South Africa and Wales select players from Toulon, demonstrating the importance of prioritizing the best talent.

Open Garden developers created Greenstone, a device that strengthens off-the-grid networks for their app, FireChat.  FireChat allows users to communicate without internet or mobile signal via Apple's Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF) or Android's similar Bluetooth feature.  MCF creates a wireless mesh network, connecting phones within a limited range. Greenstone acts as a beacon/booster, extending the network's range and storing up to 1,000 messages until other FireChat users are within range.  Currently, Greenstone is under development, with a limited range and compatibility only with FireChat.

Burlesque performer Lillian Bustle advocates for body positivity by embracing the word “fat” as a simple descriptor.  In a 2014 TED Talk, she explained that “fat” doesn’t have to be synonymous with “ugly” and that we should be more accepting of diverse body types.  Lillian’s performance allows her to present a “fat” body in a positive, glamorous light.  Studies show increased exposure to body diversity increases acceptance of different body types.  Lillian’s first burlesque performance in 2012 was empowering and helped her embrace her 240lb body.  The TED Talk, posted on YouTube in 2014, has garnered nearly 38,000 views and overwhelmingly positive feedback, further demonstrating a shift towards body positivity.

Theo Walcott and six of his Arsenal teammates: Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini, and Mesut Ozil, posed for an official portrait for Lanvin, the club’s official tailor.  Walcott has spent much of the season on the bench but came on for the last six minutes of Arsenal’s goalless draw with Chelsea.  He hopes to make his first start since March 14th when the Gunners face Hull.  The Arsenal team will wear similar attire at the FA Cup final against Aston Villa on May 30th.

A collection of over 400 props and puppets from legendary make-up effects artist Rick Baker will be auctioned off, both online and in person at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California on May 29, 2024.  Items include pieces from *Men in Black*, *Batman Forever*, *How the Grinch Stole Christmas*, *Gremlins 2*, *Mighty Joe Young*, *Planet of the Apes*, and Michael Jackson's *Moonwalker* and *Thriller* music video.  Many items are estimated to sell for thousands of dollars, with some exceeding $40,000.

Seven-year-old Carwyn Scott-Howell died in a skiing accident in the French Alps after getting separated from his family.  He fell 164ft into dense woodland.  His footprints in the snow led to the discovery of his body.  His family describes him as a daring and outgoing boy who loved skiing and the outdoors.  They are devastated by his death.

Fifteen-year-old Laura Scurr developed anorexia after being bullied about her weight.  At her lowest point, she ate only 100 calories a day, hiding food from her mother.  Her starvation led to heart problems and hospitalization.  With support from eating disorder organizations and mental health services, Laura recovered. Now, with improved body image and confidence, she is a Miss Teen GB semi-finalist, a competition promoting positive body image for young girls.

Liverpool unveiled their new home kit, designed by New Balance,  at Anfield.  Raheem Sterling, Daniel Sturridge, Martin Skrtel, and Simon Mignolet modeled the new strip. Sterling, who recently rejected a £100,000-a-week contract with Liverpool, was urged by fans to stay with the club next season.  The players expressed excitement about the upcoming FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa.  The new kit features all-white branding and a new collar style. Liverpool's new kit deal with New Balance is a record-breaking £300 million for four years.

University of Manchester researchers created a high-definition map of dark matter, showing clumps of the mystery particles across 0.4% of the sky, using data from the Dark Energy Camera.  The map, the largest of its kind, is part of the five-year Dark Energy Survey (DES), which aims to map 12.5% of the sky and create a 3D view of dark matter and dark energy. Though dark matter is invisible, its gravitational effects on galaxies allow scientists to predict its location.  The map supports theories stating galaxies form near large concentrations of dark matter.  The DES team will continue to expand the map to test cosmological theories by comparing amounts of dark and visible matter.

Manchester United has made an official offer to PSV Eindhoven for 21-year-old Memphis Depay.  United manager Louis van Gaal, who coached Depay in the 2014 World Cup, is eager to sign the young star.  PSV technical director Marcel Brands confirmed contact with Manchester United, Paris Saint-Germain, and another large European club, stating that offers are significantly higher than Tottenham’s rejected £15 million bid last summer.  Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season, helping PSV win their first Eredivisie title in seven years.  Depay’s career began at age six with VV Moordrecht, followed by Sparta Rotterdam and then PSV at age 12.  He is a fast, skilled player with a powerful right foot, often playing on the left wing.  Some believe Depay’s talent rivals a young Cristiano Ronaldo, while others compare him to Arjen Robben.  Depay has also achieved international success, scoring key goals for the Netherlands in the 2014 World Cup.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City 3-1 in a commanding performance. Tammy Abraham scored twice, and Dominic Solanke added a late goal to secure the victory.  Chelsea's midfield controlled the game, and their defense effectively neutralized City's attack.  Standout players for Chelsea included Abraham, Solanke, Charlie Colkett, Jake Clarke-Salter, and Ola Aina.  For City, Brandon Barker showed flashes of brilliance, and Isaac Buckley-Ricketts scored their lone goal. Despite some individual bright spots, City struggled to create consistent chances against a strong Chelsea side.

Marco Rubio believes that sexual preference is something people are born with, but that marriage should be defined as between one man and one woman.  He stated that the legality of same-sex marriage should be determined by state legislatures rather than the courts. While personally disagreeing with same-sex marriage, Rubio said he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staff member.  Rubio announced his presidential candidacy last week and has reportedly received substantial financial backing.

Pablo and Ilze, a couple who met in 2011, quit their jobs to cycle the world.  They’ve spent about a year cycling through 16 countries, covering almost 7,000 miles.  To keep costs down, they primarily camp, using websites like Couchsurfing and Warmshowers.  They spend less than three euros a day each, mostly on food. Their route started in London, went through Western and Southern Europe, then into Eastern Europe and Turkey, and they plan to continue through Asia and the Americas.

A Texas couple is suing Premiere Photos owner James Evans for allegedly printing a racial slur on photo booth pictures from their 2012 wedding.  The bride's sister informed the couple months later.  Evans denies the allegations and reportedly told the couple to "sue me."  The couple's attorney, Cathy Hale, says they pursued legal action after Evans failed to address the issue.  The lawsuit, filed under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act, claims negligence and breach of contract. Evans denies responsibility, citing lack of evidence. The couple seeks an apology. Mediation is scheduled, with a trial set for July if needed.

Mike Brown is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion, sustained after the France game.  Although there was no single incident, he experienced headaches and didn't feel right. He withdrew from Harlequins' match against Saracens and is unsure when he will return.  Brown's caution stems from awareness of the long-term dangers of concussion, highlighted by cases like Johnny Sexton and Geoff Parling, and reinforced by World Rugby's online modules. He previously withdrew from the Ireland match due to concussion symptoms after being knocked out against Italy.  Brown believes increased awareness is crucial and encourages others to prioritize their health.

A Cambridge statistician suggests that increased smartphone use may be causing couples to have sex less often.  Research shows Britons are having sex less frequently since the rise of the internet, down from five times a month in 1990, to four in 2000, and now three.  The blending of work and private life, constant email checking, and competing demands for time are cited as possible reasons for prioritizing sex less.

Tibetan Mastiffs, once highly valued status symbols in China, fetching prices up to £1.2 million, are now being sent to slaughterhouses for hotpot meat and leather.  This is due to China's anti-corruption crackdown, which stopped the practice of gifting these dogs to officials, and city bans on large dogs.  Overbreeding led to lower quality dogs, and urbanization made city living unsuitable for them.  Rescued dogs were found in poor conditions, some dead from starvation and injuries, highlighting the cruel fate of these animals.

A survey of 600 women in the Paris area found that every woman had experienced sexual harassment or assault on public transport.  Half of the women polled experienced this before age 18.  The harassment ranged from insults and unwanted attention to sexual assault and rape.  This has led to fear and altered behavior for women using public transport.  The High Council for Gender Equality has called for a public awareness campaign to address the issue and educate people that these actions are punishable offenses.

Direct Line's #everydayfix competition tasked design groups with creating products to address common everyday emergencies.  Three finalists were chosen: Snooze, an alarm clock silencing phone notifications; Forget Me Lock, a key fob indicating whether a door is locked; and Nipper, a small phone charger powered by household batteries. The public can vote for their favorite on Twitter using retweets, and the winner will receive Kickstarter funding.  Other designs included a helmet with bone conduction headphones for directions, a parking spot finder, and an app relaying messages when a phone's battery dies.

Vera Baird, Northumbria's Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC), awarded £500,000 to Victims First Northumbria, a charity where she is a director alongside Northumbria's Chief Constable, Sue Sim.  This has led to a Ministry of Justice probe, as critics cite a conflict of interest.  Baird maintains proper procedure was followed, while critics like Keith Vaz, Home Affairs Committee Chairman, call the situation inappropriate and question PCCs' power to allocate public funds to charities.  Sim, who will retire in June, was previously investigated for bullying by Baird.  The Ministry of Justice will investigate potential conflicts of interest and may cease funding if any are found. Victims First Northumbria was created after a decline in Victim Support participation, but some are hesitant to engage with a service partly run by Sim.

In Philadelphia, 21-year-old Corry Campbell, believing Greg Valecce, 53, hurt his cat, led a group in a three-day assault.  Valecce was beaten, tied to a chair, and tattooed with offensive images by Campbell and Carl Halin, 18.  Campbell’s girlfriend, Sandra Ng, 19, also participated in the assault.  Valecce suffered broken bones and psychological trauma.  Campbell and Halin received 20-year sentences, Ng received 23 months, and two other individuals await sentencing or trial.

Manchester United has made an official approach to sign 21-year-old Memphis Depay from PSV Eindhoven.  United manager Louis van Gaal, who coached Depay in the 2014 World Cup, is eager to sign the player.  PSV technical director Marcel Brands confirmed contact with Manchester United, Paris Saint-Germain, and another large European club, stating the offers are much higher than Tottenham’s rejected £15 million bid last summer.  Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season, helping PSV win their first Eredivise title in seven years.  Depay is considered a highly talented young player with comparisons to Arjen Robben and Cristiano Ronaldo. He has also had international success, scoring goals for the Netherlands in the 2014 World Cup.

Chelsea defeated Manchester City 3-1 in a commanding performance. Tammy Abraham scored two goals, and Dominic Solanke added a third.  Despite a goal from Isaac Buckley-Ricketts, Manchester City struggled against Chelsea's strong defense and vibrant attack.  Standout players for Chelsea included Abraham, Solanke, Charlie Colkett, Jake Clarke-Salter, and Ola Aina.  Brandon Barker was Manchester City's best player, though he may have overextended himself at times. Other notable players for City included Tosin Adarabioyo and Cameron Humphreys-Grant.

Marco Rubio believes that sexual preference is something people are born with, but that marriage should be between a man and a woman.  While he personally disagrees with same-sex marriage, he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staff member.  He stated that states should regulate marriage and that legalizing same-sex marriage is not a constitutional right. Also, he announced his candidacy for president and has received strong financial backing.

Pablo and Ilze, a couple who met in 2011, quit their jobs to cycle the world.  They travel astonishingly cheaply, spending less than three euros a day each over the first 356 days of their trip.  They've covered almost 7,000 miles through 16 countries, primarily camping or using hosting websites. Food is their main expense, costing 2.74 euros per day. Their route began in London, went through Western and Southern Europe, then into the Balkans, Greece, and Turkey.  They plan to continue through Asia, across the Pacific, and down the length of the Americas.

Mike Brown is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion, sustained after the France game.  Although there was no single incident, he experienced headaches and didn't feel right. He withdrew from Harlequins' match against Saracens and is unsure when he will return.  Brown's caution stems from awareness of the long-term dangers of concussion, highlighted by cases like Johnny Sexton and Geoff Parling, and reinforced by World Rugby's online modules. He previously withdrew from the Ireland match due to concussion symptoms after being knocked out against Italy.  Brown believes increased awareness is crucial and encourages others to prioritize their health.

A Cambridge statistician suggests that increased smartphone use may be causing couples to have sex less often.  Research indicates Britons are having sex less frequently since the rise of the internet, down from five times a month in 1990, to four in 2000, and now three.  This decrease is possibly due to the blurring of lines between public and private life as people constantly check emails, reducing couple’s quiet time together.  Increased connectivity and a busier lifestyle also contribute to this decline, pushing sex lower on people’s priority lists.

Tibetan Mastiffs, previously prized and costing up to £1.2 million, are now being sent to slaughterhouses for hotpot meat and leather in China. This is due to China's anti-corruption crackdown, which stopped officials from accepting them as gifts, and city bans on dogs over 50kg.  Cross-breeding and urbanisation also contributed to their decline. Rescued dogs were found in poor condition, some dead from starvation and injuries.  Breeders and gangs are selling the dogs to slaughterhouses.

Direct Line's #everydayfix competition tasked design groups with creating products to address common everyday emergencies.  Three finalists were chosen: Snooze, an alarm clock silencing phone notifications; Forget Me Lock, a key fob indicating whether a door is locked; and Nipper, a tiny charger powered by household batteries. The public can vote for their favorite on Twitter using retweets, and the winner will receive Kickstarter funding.  Other designs included a helmet with directional audio, a parking space finder, and a message relay app for dead phones.

Qatar Airways, headquartered in Doha, connects over 160 international destinations across Africa, Central Asia, Europe, Far East, South Asia, Middle East, North America, South America, and Oceania.  They operate from Hamad International Airport, using a fleet of over 200 aircraft.

Paul Merson and Andros Townsend’s feud reignited after Townsend played only seven minutes in Tottenham’s draw against Burnley.  Merson’s initial criticism of Townsend’s England selection was proven wrong when Townsend scored against Italy, leading Merson to admit his mistake.  Despite seemingly resolving their differences, Merson mocked Townsend’s limited game time against Burnley.

Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.  Muto would be loaned to Vitesse Arnhem next season if the transfer is completed.  While a £4 million deal has been suggested, Muto has not yet decided if he will join Chelsea. He graduated from Keio University with an economics degree two weeks prior to the offer.  Muto scored 13 goals in his debut season with FC Tokyo, was named in the J-League's best XI, and has 11 caps for Japan with one goal.

A Finnish study of over 12,000 children published in Pediatrics indicates a correlation between antibiotic use in babies under six months old and increased likelihood of being overweight by age two.  Repeated prescriptions before age two further elevated this risk, especially in boys, who also experienced slightly increased height. While the study doesn't definitively prove causation, researchers suggest antibiotics may kill gut bacteria that consume food, leading to increased calorie absorption and potentially stimulating appetite.  This may contribute to the childhood obesity epidemic, emphasizing the importance of judicious antibiotic use in infants.

A Queen's Guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace, dropping his rifle and bearskin. The incident, recorded by tourist David Meadwell, happened as the guard took his position. Despite the fall, the guard quickly regained his composure and resumed his duties, though visibly embarrassed. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment.

A&E Networks is remaking the 1977 miniseries *Roots*, which garnered over 100 million viewers, for a 2016 audience.  LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version.  The remake will air simultaneously on A&E, Lifetime, and History.  Producers intend to make the miniseries more reflective of Alex Haley's novel, *Roots: The Saga of an American Family*, and will consult scholars to ensure authenticity.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, alleges that he was assaulted by Clarence House staff on his first day of work in 1978.  He claims he was pinned to a chair and groped by male staff members who attempted to remove his trousers. Though he reported the incident, he left the job the same day and was allegedly threatened to keep quiet.  He contacted palace officials again in 2022 after news of an investigation into historical child sex abuse cases.  His complaint was initially rebuffed but eventually passed to Scotland Yard. A retired royal aide was questioned but denied involvement.  The Palace has stated they will cooperate fully with the police investigation.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced their pregnancy in a rap video parody of the "Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" theme song. The video, viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube, features the couple rapping about their journey to parenthood.  They initially told family and friends they weren't ready for kids, but after two months of trying to conceive, Melissa discovered she was pregnant.  The video concludes with a sonogram image.  The couple made the video to share the news with distant loved ones and were surprised by its viral success.  Jesse is the great-great-grandson of Oregon pioneer Joseph Lafayette Meek.  This isn't the first time the sitcom theme has been used for a pregnancy announcement; a Pennsylvania couple did so last year.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction.  The light gray jacket and skirt, originally slate blue-gray, were part of a 150-item collection from James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head.  Tumblin acquired the dress for $20 in the 1960s. Other notable sales included a hat worn by Leigh ($52,500), Clark Gable's suit ($55,000), and a bonnet worn by Leigh and Olivia de Havilland ($30,000).

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the railing.  He fell 10-12 feet, but was rescued by his parents before help arrived. The child suffered minor injuries and is in stable condition. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the parents.

A deactivated speed camera, previously monitoring a 30mph zone in Handsworth, Birmingham, has been mysteriously repositioned to face a private residence.  Inactive since 2013 due to obsolete technology, the camera is slated for removal or other appropriate action by the Birmingham City Council.  A pilot program for a limited number of sites using updated digital technology is currently under development, but this specific camera is not included in the plan.

Usain Bolt will compete in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2nd and 3rd as part of the Jamaican team.  Bolt stated that he is “fit, healthy and ready to run”.  The JAAA General Secretary expressed excitement about Bolt’s participation in the event.

Neymar and teammate Dani Alves attended a Barcelona basketball game against Real Madrid, which Barcelona won 85-80.  Real Madrid remains ahead of Barcelona in their Euro League division by points difference.  Neymar, who captained Brazil to a 1-0 victory over Chile at the Emirates, returns to La Liga with Barcelona on Sunday to play Celta Vigo.  Neymar was accompanied to the basketball game by his sister Rafaella.

Between Friday and Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued at sea. Save the Children fears 400 migrants are missing after their boat capsized, though the Italian Coast Guard has not confirmed this. Over 10,000 migrants arrived in Italy in the first three months of 2015, mostly from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, transiting through Libya. At least 480 migrants have died this year due to bad weather and overcrowded vessels.

Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over other elite clubs, including Liverpool, after leaving Barcelona.  Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is pleased with Sanchez's decision and performance, acknowledging Liverpool's potential use of their interest in Sanchez as leverage during Luis Suarez's transfer to Barcelona.  Wenger praised Sanchez's quick adaptation and impact on the team.  He downplayed rumors of a summer transfer for Raheem Sterling and commended Brendan Rodgers' management of Liverpool despite losing Suarez and dealing with Sturridge's injury.

Four-time Olympic champion Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7.  Wiggins aims to surpass Rohan Dennis's current record of 52.491km. Tickets go on sale April 19, and the event will be broadcast on Sky Sports.  This attempt is part of Wiggins' return to track cycling as he pursues a British record eighth Olympic medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

Serena Williams had to fight to beat Sara Errani 4-6 7-6(3) 6-3 in the Fed Cup on Sunday, but the US still lost 3-2 to Italy and were relegated to World Group II. Williams stated that the match was an "eye-opener," showing her she wasn't as prepared for the clay court season as she thought.  Despite winning, Williams said she needs to adjust her play style for clay courts.  The US captain, Mary Joe Fernandez, is optimistic about getting back into the World Group next year.

River Plate would like to re-sign Radamel Falcao.  Falcao played for River Plate for eight years, from 2001 (age 15) to 2009, scoring 34 goals in 90 appearances.  Although River Plate’s vice president says they “dream of Falcao” and “the doors are open,” they admit a deal is complicated.  Falcao is currently on loan to Manchester United from Monaco, but has only scored four goals this season.  It is uncertain whether Manchester United will keep him or if he will return to Monaco.

Ella Henderson, a finalist on the X Factor and pop star, is the new face of Batiste dry shampoo's 2015 "Ready For It" campaign.  This is Henderson's first brand collaboration.  The campaign features Henderson in various hairstyles, including wavy, down, and a half-ponytail, against a blurred city backdrop.  The partnership was formed by the MILES agency and includes a TV ad featuring Henderson's single, "Mirror Man."  Henderson is excited about the partnership, stating that she regularly uses the product.  Mark Hargreaves of Crown Talent & Media Group, Henderson's management, stated the partnership is a natural fit between a talented artist and a well-loved brand.

Aaron Siler, wanted for felony probation and parole violation, was shot and killed by Officer Pablo Torres on March 14 following a vehicle and foot pursuit.  This incident occurred ten days after Torres shot and wounded 66-year-old Terry Knight, who was armed with knives.  While investigations are ongoing for the Siler shooting, the District Attorney deemed the shooting of Knight justified.  A billboard erected by the Kenosha Professional Police Association featuring Torres and his K9 thanking the community for their support has sparked outrage among Siler's family and friends, who are calling for its removal.  The police association claims no offense was intended.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed by militants in clashes near the border with Pakistan in the town of Negur.  A militant group, Jaish al Adal, claimed responsibility.  Jaish al Adal, an anti-Iranian Sunni Muslim group, aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan.  Iranian officials have requested Pakistani authorities apprehend the surviving militants.  Pakistan condemned the attack and is investigating.

Japan's Defense Minister Gen Nakatani recently addressed parliament, stating that the Air Self Defense Force has never encountered extraterrestrial UFOs.  While jets are scrambled to investigate unidentified flying objects that could violate Japanese airspace, these are often birds or other aircraft.  This topic arose after flamboyant wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki questioned the government's handling of extraterrestrial threats and research into alien visitors. Inoki, known for his past wrestling career and various other endeavors, claims to have personally seen a UFO. This isn't the first time Japanese politicians have discussed the implications of alien visitors, with a 2007 discussion focusing on the legal ramifications of defending against an extraterrestrial invasion.

35-year-old Jin Pai was hospitalized after he cut his leg and buttocks on a broken toilet at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport.  He was standing on the toilet rim to avoid touching the seat due to cleanliness concerns when it broke.  He called his friends for help before being taken to a hospital for stitches.  Although he initially confessed to squatting on the toilet, he later claimed he was sitting when it broke.  Authorities believe the incident was accidental.

56-year-old Kevin Rebbie from Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested and charged with aggravated indecent assault, unlawful contact with a minor, sexual abuse of children, and invasion of privacy.  A 15-year-old girl discovered a hidden camera placed by Rebbie under her bathroom sink, which contained videos of her and other juveniles undressing and showering.  Rebbie admitted to filming the victims, including other juveniles, over a three- or four-year period.  He also confessed to molesting the 15-year-old victim from the time she was nine until she was 13 years old.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama, age 37, created a photo series of daughters posing seriously next to their leaping fathers, dressed in suits, possibly referencing the term "salaryman."  The photos, part of a book titled "Daughter and Salary Man," show the fathers expressing a fun, heroic side, despite some pained expressions from older participants.  The photos are gaining online popularity despite little information being available about the project.

Paul Downton's dismissal as England's managing director paves the way for Kevin Pietersen's potential return to the England team.  Pietersen, who was controversially axed by Downton in 2014 after England's disastrous Ashes tour in Australia, has rejoined Surrey in an attempt to force his way back into the Test set-up for this summer's Ashes series on home soil.  Surrey begins their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt fired coach Ze Maria, rehired him, then fired him again after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani dropped the club to 16th place in the standings, six points adrift of safety.  This was Ze Maria's second stint as Ceahlaul's coach this season, having replaced Florin Marin in January. Serbian Vanya Radinovic will replace Ze Maria.

Radamel Falcao’s former Monaco teammate, Nabil Dirar, stated that Falcao was unhappy in France. However, due to Falcao’s struggles at Manchester United, Dirar believes Falcao regrets his loan move there.  Falcao only scored four goals for Manchester United and they are unlikely to pay the £46 million to make the transfer permanent. Dirar believes Falcao would have played more and participated in the Champions League if he had stayed at Monaco.

Christchurch police are seeking public assistance to identify a tall man wearing a cartoon mask and fluorescent orange sweatshirt who robbed a dairy on Union St. around 12:30 pm on Saturday.  The robber stole the till and approximately $1500 in cash. Anyone with information is asked to contact Crimestoppers.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old Texas math teacher, was arrested twice for inappropriate relationships with 15-year-old students.  The first arrest was in March, after admitting to kissing a student and letting him touch her breasts.  A second 15-year-old student then came forward, alleging Granado had sex with him in her car on two nights in January.  Granado was arrested again in April and released on bail.  She is currently on administrative leave.

In Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, a crocodile was filmed swimming in a marina with a dead dog in its mouth.  The dog belonged to a local bike shop owner and was likely curious about the crocodile before it was snatched. The crocodile held the dog for hours, attracting onlookers.  Crocodiles are common in the area, which is built near mangrove habitats and a crocodile sanctuary.  The American Crocodiles in the region can grow up to 6 meters long and are living closer to humans due to urbanization.  The video of the incident has garnered over 500,000 views online, with some viewers expressing horror.

Hull City manager Steve Bruce remains confident his team can avoid relegation despite a 2-0 loss to Southampton, which leaves them two points above the relegation zone.  He believes eight or nine wins may be enough to stay up. Hull City face difficult upcoming matches against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham, and Manchester United.  Bruce cites long-term injuries to key players including Mohamed Diame, James Chester, Michael Dawson, Nikica Jelavic, and Robert Snodgrass as contributing factors to their struggles.  Southampton's win, secured by goals from James Ward-Prowse and Graziano Pellè, moved them up to fifth place.  Southampton manager Ronald Koeman plans to address his team regarding Sadio Mané attempting to take a penalty designated for Ward-Prowse.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, had his students change answers on their SATs exams after the testing session had ended and also altered answers himself.  Following an investigation, the Department for Education voided the entire school's SATs results.  Guffick, while admitting to the actions, claimed he asked students to clarify, not change, their answers.  The National College for Teaching and Leadership issued a ban from the classroom for at least two years, citing the impact of Guffick's actions on the school and students.  Guffick has 28 days to appeal the decision.

Manchester United goalkeeper Anders Lindegaard, who married Swedish model Misse Beqiri in 2014, isn't getting much playing time, but he's enjoying life off the field.  Lindegaard and Beqiri have a son and have been together since 2012.  Beqiri regularly posts modeling photos on her Instagram account.  Lindegaard has struggled to make an impact at Manchester United, making only 19 league appearances in five seasons and is now third-choice goalkeeper. He was linked with a move to FC Midtjylland, but the deal fell through.

Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson’s 10-feet-tall, glowing blue letters that once adorned Yankee Stadium (1976-2008) failed to sell at a Sotheby’s auction.  Despite an estimated value of $300,000-$600,000, the only bid of $260,000 came from a Sotheby’s employee.  A Mets bullpen car from the late 60s, estimated at $20,000-$30,000, sold for $112,500.

Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe were caught inhaling nitrous oxide and pictured with shisha pipes. Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers spoke to both players about their responsibilities as professional athletes. Neither player will be disciplined, and Rodgers wants to move forward. Rodgers believes setbacks, like last season's title race and Capital One Cup semi-final loss, are part of the journey to success, citing examples of Champions League winners who experienced losses before achieving victory.  He is focused on leading Liverpool to their first FA Cup final of his reign with the return of Steven Gerrard from suspension.

Mesut Ozil returned to London after playing in Germany’s 2-0 win against Georgia in a Euro 2016 qualifier.  He posted a picture with his dog captioned, “Home Sweet Home.”  Although he missed Arsenal’s previous game against Newcastle due to illness, he is expected to start in the upcoming match against Liverpool.  Since returning from injury, Ozil has made four assists and scored three goals. He says he is adjusting to English football and “fits perfectly.”

Josep Maria Bartomeu, president of Barcelona, has stated that the club has no plans to replace Luis Enrique, whose contract extends to 2016.  Bartomeu is pleased with Enrique's performance, particularly after the Champions League game against PSG and the win against Valencia.  Barcelona are contending for three titles this season.  The win against Valencia featured goals by Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson, Liverpool's vice-captain, has agreed to a new long-term contract through 2020 worth approximately £100,000 a week.  Henderson, 24, whose current contract had 14 months remaining, is the third Liverpool player to sign a contract extension this season, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. He is expected to be considered for club captain after Steven Gerrard’s departure.  Contract talks with Raheem Sterling are expected to resume at the end of the season.

Filipe Luis intends to remain at Chelsea for the duration of his three-year contract, despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him.  While Luis has found it challenging to secure the left back position, he is happy at Chelsea.  His focus is now on the Premier League, where Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is urging the team to maintain focus and win every game. Luis acknowledges the difficulty of the remaining nine games.

Nathan Hughes's three-match ban for accidentally knocking out George North has been overturned on appeal.  Hughes's knee hit North's head as he scored a try, resulting in North being stretchered off the field, unconscious. This was North's third concussion in two months, requiring him to take a month off from playing. While some condemned Hughes, many, including Wasps captain James Haskell and other players, defended him, citing a lack of intent.  The appeal panel agreed, concluding the incident was accidental and rescinding Hughes's red card and ban. He is now free to play but is not expected back until Wasps play Exeter on April 26.

Seattle resident Tim Durkan captured photos of vibrant sunsets over Washington.  These striking sunsets resulted from wildfires in southeastern Siberia, started by farmers burning grass that spread rapidly due to strong winds. The smoke traveled across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, causing the red sunsets.  The smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors like blue and green, allowing reds and oranges to dominate.  As the smoke clears, the sunsets will return to normal.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen and later returned with red spray-painted rims, red detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel.  Schoenig reacted positively, thanking the thieves on Facebook for "pimping out" her car.  She is now having the car professionally cleaned due to the smell of cigarettes and marijuana and has created a smoothie named after the man who helped locate her car.

Manchester City players have incentive-based contracts, tied to Champions League qualification, to comply with Financial Fair Play rules.  If they fail to qualify, players like Aguero, Silva, Hart, and Toure will lose £500,000 each in bonuses, totaling £12 million in squad bonuses.  City's recent loss to Manchester United puts them four points ahead of Liverpool, jeopardizing their Champions League qualification hopes.  Manager Pellegrini admits the team's performance has declined in recent months.  This could also impact their ability to attract top talent like Paul Pogba, who is also a target for Manchester United.

Manchester United’s Under 18 team defeated Manchester City’s Under 18 team 1-0. Callum Gribbin scored the winning goal, a free kick, for Manchester United.  The game was played at Altrincham’s stadium in front of 1,000 fans. Many of the players were from Manchester.  Manchester United’s coach, Paul McGuinness, wanted to give his young players experience in a setting similar to what they might encounter playing for the senior team.  Both teams showed promising talent.

Joe Hart, earning his 50th cap, called Gianluigi Buffon, who earned his 147th cap, a "legend of the game."  Hart, at 27, admires the 37-year-old Buffon and says he is still learning from veterans like him.  He wants to continue playing well for club and country to increase his cap total.

Chipotle has partnered with Postmates to deliver online and mobile orders in 67 cities with a 9% service charge plus Postmates’ fees.  Postmates uses independent contractors similar to Uber.  Starbucks also uses Postmates for delivery.  Taco Bell, McDonald’s, and Burger King are also developing delivery services.  Presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton have both been spotted at Chipotle.

Parents of Boston Marathon bombing’s youngest victim, Martin Richard, are requesting the death penalty be removed from the case against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.  While acknowledging the brutality of the crimes and the pain their family has endured, they support life imprisonment without parole and the waiving of all appeal rights in exchange for taking the death penalty off the table. They believe this will allow their family and the city of Boston to heal and move forward. They also want to avoid reliving the trauma through years of appeals.

A mystery billionaire spent £400 million to convert a Boeing 747 into a luxury home.  The plane, customized over three years, includes bedrooms, multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, and an "aeroloft" with eight beds on the upper deck.  It can accommodate dozens of guests.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with the Dragon spacecraft to resupply the International Space Station. The rocket successfully launched, but landing the rocket stage on a drone ship failed. SpaceX founder Elon Musk tweeted that the rocket landed too hard and tipped over.  The Dragon will deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies to the ISS, including an espresso maker. After five weeks, the Dragon will return to Earth with 3,000 pounds of cargo. This is SpaceX's sixth resupply mission to the ISS.  Landing the rocket stage is part of SpaceX's plan to reduce the cost of space travel by reusing rockets.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding held at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel in Las Vegas on April 23, 2015.  The wedding is part of a contest by NBC's *Today* show, and the winning couple will also receive a reception, a two-night hotel stay, airfare, and tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show.  The chapel is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit outside of Elvis's Memphis home. Couples entered the contest by submitting photos and videos explaining why they deserved to win.

Liverpool defeated Newcastle 2-0, with goals from Sterling and Allen.  Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool can make up the four points separating them and Manchester City in the race for the Champions League.  Both Henderson and Mignolet played their 47th game of the season, equalling the record for appearances by any player in the top five European leagues.

Roma defeated Napoli 1-0 at home, ending a four-month home winless streak in Serie A. Pjanic scored the sole goal in the 25th minute off a counter-attack.  Roma goalkeeper De Sanctis preserved the victory with numerous saves in the second half.  This win puts second-place Roma four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli’s winless streak extends to five games.  Heightened security measures were in place due to past fan violence, but no incidents were reported. Roma played without Totti and Gervinho.  Napoli may have been denied a penalty when Manolas contacted De Guzman. De Sanctis made key saves against Mertens and Gabbiadini to secure the win for Roma.

Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played to a 0-0 draw. Doncaster’s media team’s match highlight video on YouTube was 27 seconds long, 14 seconds of which was match action, including the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle.

Roland Giroux has a unique relationship with his blood parrot cichlid.  He interacts with his fish by stroking and massaging it in its tank. The fish enjoys this interaction, returning for more even after swimming away.  Giroux developed this bond after removing two other fish from the tank for bullying the cichlid. He began hand-feeding it and noticed it becoming more sociable, eventually enjoying being stroked and becoming frustrated if Giroux doesn't interact with it daily.  He now plays with the fish for at least 15 minutes each day.

Ben Stokes is a fiery character in the English cricket team, known for both his on-field aggression and occasional outbursts.  While his behavior sometimes needs to be managed, England values Stokes's exuberance and wants to foster his natural talent.  They believe he can be a key player, contributing both runs and wickets, as long as his aggression is channeled appropriately.  The team plans to play Stokes as much as possible to help him reach his full potential.

Wales’ Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium at Cardiff City Stadium on June 12th has sold out its 33,000 seats.  Both teams are tied atop Group B with 11 points each, though Belgium is ranked higher due to goal difference.  Despite the Millennium Stadium’s larger capacity, the match will be played at Cardiff City Stadium due to UEFA rules about venue changes and the Welsh team’s preference for the smaller stadium.

Defending champion England U17 will face Italy, Holland, and the Republic of Ireland in Group D of the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. The team, coached by John Peacock, includes players from various Premier League clubs, such as Chelsea's Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo, Arsenal's Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi, and Liverpool's Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold. England's matches are scheduled for May 7 (Italy), May 10 (Holland), and May 13 (Ireland).

Manchester City are looking to sign Evangelos Patoulidis, a 14-year-old Anderlecht playmaker who has also garnered interest from Arsenal and Barcelona.  Patoulidis previously rejected Barcelona at age 12 to continue his studies. City have spoken with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock hoping to agree on a compensation package.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found strangled and beaten to death in a Fulham flat at the end of March.  A 23-year-old man was arrested but released on bail.  Police are seeking information from anyone who had contact with Santillan in the hours before her death.

Dawn, who had seven miscarriages, accused her housemate Jamie of stealing £207 she had saved for a gravestone for one of her babies.  A lie detector test on The Jeremy Kyle Show proved Jamie had taken the money. Jamie had also sent a Facebook message to Dawn confessing to the theft, but blaming his girlfriend.  Dawn was devastated by the betrayal.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis (mostly women, children, elderly, and ill) in northern Iraq.  Arab tribal leaders coordinated the release with Peshmerga forces, who then transported the freed Yazidis to Irbil.  This is not the first instance of ISIS releasing Yazidis since their attacks last summer, which displaced hundreds of thousands and led to a humanitarian crisis.  Last year, ISIS slaughtered hundreds of Yazidis and enslaved and raped female captives.  An international coalition responded with aid, rescues, and airstrikes.

Harry Kane, nominated for PFA Player and Young Player of the Season, is featured in a new animated video by Copa90. The video highlights some of Kane’s best goals and celebrations of the season, including goals against Chelsea, Arsenal, and his England debut goal.  The video’s title, “Harry Kane – PFA Player of the Year?” references the upcoming awards ceremony where he is a contender for the top prize against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez.

Despite Liverpool's trophyless season and likely absence from the top four, Jamie Carragher supports Brendan Rodgers as the team's leader.  Carragher believes the new players haven't fully integrated yet and that Rodgers' job is to identify areas for improvement and make the right signings to get back into the top four and win trophies next season.  Carragher also received a Beacon Award for his community work with the 23 Foundation, providing coaching in underprivileged areas of Merseyside.

Four-year-old James Hayward's toy Nerf gun was confiscated at East Midlands Airport because it was considered a security risk.  His father, Phil Hayward, called the security check 'ludicrous' and 'over-zealous'.  Although offered to have the toy mailed to their home, the family opted to purchase a new one upon returning from their holiday.  The airport maintains their actions were in accordance with government regulations prohibiting items resembling prohibited items, such as replica guns.

A man from Humpty Doo in the Northern Territory, Australia, advertised for a girlfriend/wife on Gumtree.  He described himself as a 31-year-old, white, tattooed, athletic male, 175cm tall, financially successful, and owning property.  His requirements include a non-smoker and non-drinker who is fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, a good cook, and great in bed.  He offers perks such as gym membership, phone, laptop, and potentially a company car. He states all reasonable offers will be considered, but former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke's proposal to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 and change the definition of "home-grown" to mean training in England for three years before age 18 (instead of 21) has the support of five former England managers.  They argue that failure to implement these changes will hurt English football and widen the gap between England and top international teams.  They cite the shrinking pool of English talent at the top level as a key reason for England's failure to win major tournaments since 1966, despite the emergence of promising young players like Barkley, Sterling, and Kane.

In the upcoming Poldark episode, Demelza gives birth to a daughter shortly after announcing her pregnancy in the previous episode.  Ross Poldark professes his love for Demelza. Fans noted the rapid progression of Demelza's pregnancy, comparing it to Elizabeth's similarly fast pregnancy in the show. One fan tweeted, "If you are pregnant in Poldark times expect to have it in the next 10 minutes."

Leicester City, currently bottom of the Barclays Premier League, are three points from safety after consecutive wins. Manager Nigel Pearson has urged his team to concentrate on their own performance and not be distracted by their relegation rivals. He stressed the importance of focusing on their remaining games to maintain their chance of survival. While acknowledging the positive impact of other teams' results, Pearson cautioned against excessive optimism and emphasized the need for continued focus.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara swam almost 14,000 miles from Russia to Mexico, setting a new record for the longest mammal migration.  This journey, surpassing the previous record of 10,190 miles held by a humpback whale, suggests Varvara may be an eastern gray whale, not a western gray whale as previously thought.  This raises questions about the genetic differences between the two and could mean the endangered western gray whale population is even smaller than believed.

Off the east coast of Hokkaido Island, Japan, 1,000-1,640 feet of seabed rose 30-50 feet above sea level, creating a new 100-foot wide stretch of coastline.  Geologists believe melting snow and ice caused a nearby landslide, forcing the seabed upwards.  Local residents reported no tremors or sounds, and authorities do not expect further expansion.

Gregory van der Wiel denies rumors of leaving Paris Saint-Germain, stating his love for the club, city, and teammates.  Despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc over being dropped from a Champions League match, Van der Wiel insists he is happy and wants to sign a new contract.  However, PSG's continued interest in Dani Alves may impact Van der Wiel's future with the club.

Carlos Tevez, whose contract with Juventus expires at the end of next season, has told the club he wants to leave this summer to return to Boca Juniors.  Boca Juniors confirmed they are close to a deal, but Tevez must first terminate his Juventus contract. Juventus, while reluctant to lose their top scorer (17 goals), has accepted Tevez’s decision and begun seeking replacements.  Tevez’s international manager has stated that a move to Boca Juniors would not be a step down for the player.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped his trousers during his team's 6-1 Champions League quarter-final win over Porto.  The incident exposed his underwear, about which Guardiola joked he'd need new ones for the next match.  Bayern's win, including goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso and two from Robert Lewandowski, secured their place in the Champions League semi-finals.

A three-car collision on the Brisbane Valley Highway near Fernvale injured ten people, including four children. Two adults and two children with moderate injuries were airlifted to Princess Alexandra Hospital. Six others, including three children, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries. One person was trapped and freed using hydraulic cutting gear. The highway was closed for several hours with diversions in place.

Arsenal’s Mesut Ozil showed off his new Apple Watch on Instagram, comparing it to Michael Knight’s watch from Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to start against Chelsea on Sunday.  Meanwhile, Ray Parlour believes Jack Wilshere is the future of Arsenal, but his fitness record remains a concern.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby on Sunday.  He has sent off two Manchester United players and one Manchester City player this season.  Vincent Kompany's red card was during an international match between Belgium and Israel.  The Manchester derby could determine which team finishes second in the Premier League.

Bob Katter accused the Queensland government of treating Billy Gordon like a "little black puppet on a string," assuming he would resign after domestic violence accusations and admitting to a criminal past. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, cited his own experience with racism and defended his statement, explaining the term "black puppet" stemmed from his background and belief that the government's actions had racial overtones.  He questioned why Gordon was expected to resign when other federal MPs in similar situations weren't.  While some criticized Katter's terminology, he maintained that Gordon should not become a puppet for the government like other independent MPs have.

19-year-old Dayna Dobias, who has cerebral palsy, creates dance videos to challenge stereotypes about disabilities.  She aims to inspire others and change how people with disabilities are portrayed in media.  Despite facing bullying and judgment, Dayna wants to be seen as a typical teenager, emphasizing her ability to drive, attend college, and dance, defying initial medical expectations.  She now also does motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City has inquired about acquiring Javier Hernandez from Manchester United.  Hernandez is also wanted by eight European clubs, including Southampton, Stoke City, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, and Inter Milan. Manchester United wants around £8 million for Hernandez.  Meanwhile, Manchester United has offered Andreas Pereira a revised contract after he rejected their initial offer.  Pereira has interest from Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord.

In Los Angeles early Saturday morning, a driver and his two passengers escaped injury after an altercation with at least three people at a gas station. The suspects allegedly attempted to carjack the driver, then doused his white Dodge Charger with gasoline and set it on fire.  The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson, using surveillance video as evidence. The suspects remain at large.

Iowa chiropractor Charles Manuel surrendered his license after admitting to exchanging services for sex with patients, performing exorcisms, and recommending patients stop taking prescribed medications.  He agreed not to seek reinstatement for at least 10 years.  Despite these actions, he received positive patient satisfaction reviews online.

A Russian SU-27 Flanker intercepted a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance aircraft over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. alleges the Russian pilot acted unsafely and unprofessionally due to aggressive maneuvers and high speed near the U.S. aircraft. Russia claims the U.S. plane was flying toward the Russian border with its transponder off, which the U.S. denies.  Similar incidents between these two types of aircraft have occurred before, including one over the Sea of Okhotsk.  The U.S. will complain to Russia through diplomatic channels.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle, secured inside a locked case in his vehicle, was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot shortly before President Obama's visit to Utah.  The thief broke the car window and ripped the rifle case free, also stealing bags, clothing, and tools. Some items were recovered at a nearby hotel, but the rifle remains missing.  The hotel lacked surveillance cameras, but the rifle's serial number has been entered into a national database.  The Secret Service was notified of the theft.

In 2012, 71-year-old Luigi Costa allegedly murdered his neighbor, Terrence Freebody, in Canberra, Australia.  Costa is accused of stomping on Freebody's head, cutting his throat, and stabbing him multiple times.
